description:
What's up San Francisco! 

VIP California is bringing the nation's largest Onesie party to the Bay Area for an unforgettable night of pub crawling!! There has been a staggering amount of interest in this date, and we have worked hard to make it the best of all. We will shutting down the Wharf for the night to accommodate the biggest gathering of Onesies ever seen!

All venues will be offering fantastic drinks specials - as low as $3 per drink! Tickets for this event will go on sale on Monday, February 13th at 7pm. Tickets will be $20 per person and are expected to sell out extremely quickly. All venues are for crawl participants only, so make sure you sign up early before our capacity is reached.
We are working very closely with Fisherman's Wharf and local police on this and there will be quite a carnival atmosphere on the night. 


2017 San Francisco Onesie Crawl

Saturday March 4

6pm-1am

Exclusive drinks specials at all participating venues on the crawl.

All applicable cover charges will be waived with your crawl wristband. 
Multiple venues at the biggest touring Onesie party in the US.

Paypal handles our merchant services, but YOU DO NOT NEED A PAYPAL ACCOUNT TO SIGN UP, JUST SELECT 'PAY WITH DEBIT OR CREDIT CARD' AT THE PAYPAL PAGE! If you do have a Paypal acount already, you can of course pay with that too!

Our website asks for shipping addresses as standard, but ALL TICKETS ARE E-TICKETS SENT BY EMAIL.

Once you have signed up, you will receive a confirmation of payment email. You will then receive by email an e-ticket for the number of people you signed up for within the next 24 hours or so.

How to check in on the day:
Bring your e-ticket and photo ID to the check-in bar for scanning on the day of the event. You can print it out if you wish but we are also able to scan it straight from your smart phone too. If you have friends who are running late or working late, it is fine to collect their wristbands on their behalf, but the purchaser must be present to collect any wristbands. In the event of the purchaser running late, we can change the name of the tickets if we receive an email from you from the same email address you purchased with. Please do not use the Facebook event discussion wall or any other social media platform to ask us questions about your order - especially on the day of the event - as there are thousands of people commenting and we cannot guarantee that your question will be answered in time.
If you have any questions about your order, you can contact us at info@vipcaliforniaevents.com

Online ticket link:

https://vipcaliforniaevents.fwscart.com/San_Francisco_Onesie_Pub_Crawl/p4474941_17042576.aspx

Check In Location:
Fisherman's Wharf. Exact address and map of ticket check in location is printed on your e-ticket.
All others participating venues will be emailed to you the week of the event, for you to download to your phone or print out. Due to the colossal amount of people following the event online we cannot name the participating bars on Facebook in order to control capacity.


Check In time: 6pm-9pm
Early arrival strongly advised, check in finishes at 9pm, no exceptions.

description:
These crazy comics love to talk about sex.  They're obsessed with it and you will be with them.Host Inanc Ino

James Barela- Portland comedy stalwart, James Barela, metes out his comedy in a visceral exploration of turbulent sexuality, lurid cautionary tales, Mexican quirks, and psychedelic cosmic wall-banging. The son of a palm reader and a sheet metal worker in Oklahoma, Barela lived in New York City for several years before settling in Portland. Delivered with a teddy bear's likability, James Barela's comedy will bring you into his unique and vulgar perspective.

Hunter Donaldson is a comedian based out of Portland, Oregon who originally hails from Fayetteville, Arkansas. He has been featured on many local Portland comedy showcases and made it to the semi-finals of the Portland Funniest Person contest. He wears sweaters and people like that and he is nice.

Patrick Fowler- With his dark humor and dry wit, Patrick Fowler has been entertaining audiences since 2011.  His deadpan delivery and awkward stage manner makes him well-liked in people with low to medium self-esteem, focusing on topics such as life, death, and all the little things in between.  Based in South Bend, Indiana, Patrick has performed in venues all over Michigan and Indiana.  He has performed at Gilda’s Laughfest, was a semifinalist in the Funniest Person in Grand Rapids, and a manager at The Drop Comedy Club in South Bend.

Tanya Nascimento

description:
Suicide is the tenth leading cause of death in the U.S. and each year, over 44,000 Americans die by suicide. Unfortunately, many suicide attempts go unreported or untreated, and these statistics may be higher. 

In the effort to reduce and prevent suicide in our local and national community, You Mean More is partnering with the American Foundation for Suicide Prevention (AFSP) to host UC Berkeley’s sixth annual Suicide Prevention Walk on Saturday, March 4, 2017. Check-in will start at 11:00 AM on Sproul and the walk will take place between 1 and 3 PM. There will be speakers, remembrance activities, and land performances. 

To participate at the walk, please register using the following link: tinyurl.com/ymmwalk2017. The deadline for online registration is on Friday, March 3, at 12 PM; however, participants are also welcome to register in-person on the day of the event. 

Proceeds of the walk will be used to fund local and national efforts for suicide prevention. For more information regarding AFSP, please visit their website at afsp.org. 

Come “March Fourth” for suicide prevention with You Mean More! If you have any questions, please contact us via e-mail at youmeanmore@gmail.com. We hope to see you there.
title: UC Berkeley Suicide Prevention Walk 2017

Joe Messina is a comic based in Philadelphia. He is a regular at Helium Comedy Club and cohosts the monthly political comedy show Party Lines at Good Good Comedy Theater. He has performed at venues throughout the country and in 2016 was featured on the Liberty Tour in Philadelphia and Denver.

The planet is Mars and the year is 2071. A tanker truck mysteriously explodes, releasing a deadly viral infection throughout a sprawling metropolis. description:
HUSHconcerts presents
An evening with Grammy Award Winners
REBIRTH BRASS BAND
And special guest
DJ MANCUB (Space Cowboys)

Saturday, March 4th, 2017
STARLINE SOCIAL CLUB
645 West Grand ave, Oakland CA 
Ages 21+
TIX: http://bit.ly/HUSHrebirthstarline

Simply put, The Rebirth Brass Band is a New Orleans institution. Formed in 1983 by the now infamous Frazier brothers, the band has evolved from playing the streets of the French Quarter to playing festivals and stages all over the world. Their persistent production of the rich, New Orleans Brass Band sound won the band a Grammy on their 2011 release, “Rebirth of New Orleans.” Rebirth is committed to upholding the tradition of brass bands while at the same time incorporating modern music into their show. Their signature brand of brass funk has won over several generations of music lovers, and in a post-Katrina world, their name and music have become the soundtrack to their musically rich hometown.  In the wake of the sometimes-stringent competition amongst brass bands, Rebirth is the undisputed leader of the pack, and they show no signs of slowing down.
title: Rebirth Brass Band at Starline Social Club

Join us for the 20th anniversary gala for HUSHconcerts
SunsetSF, Sunset Promotions, SF Funk, North Beach Jazz, MojitoSF, Sea of Dreams, Ghost Ship Halloween etc etc...

HUSH20
featuring a swanky spread of cocktails, munchables and live performances by
Rebirth Brass Band

dJ HARRY DUNCAN
TIX: http://bit.ly/HUSHrebirthbimbos

Friday, March 3rd
at Bimbos 365 Club
1025 Columbus Ave | 7:30pm Doors | 21+

HUSHconcerts celebrates 20th Anniversary in grand style at Bimbo’s
with Rebirth Brass Band, Fort Knox Five and The Jazz Mafia on March 3th, 2017

SF-based production company has been a stalwart in the Bay Area and beyond 
under a variety of names and unmatched commitment to innovation, curation, and excellence

Two decades of tireless work on behalf of creative culture has made HUSHconcerts an artistic lynchpin in the Bay Area community. Founded by John Miles and Robbie Kowal in February 1997, this bootstrapped success story has been known in turns as Sunset Promotions, SunsetSF, Silent Frisco, and since April of 2015, as HUSHconcerts. Along the way they have energized North Beach Jazz, SF Funk Fest, Sea of Dreams NYE, Ghost Ship Halloween, Icebreakers Ball, THE BIG ONE, and Mojito Café, and have been integral in the development of silent disco culture in the United States. On Friday, March 3, they celebrate their legacy with a gala celebration at Bimbo’s 365 Club. Performing that night will be two acts who have played for the HUSHfamily on more than 100 occasions, legendary Grammy Award winning New Orleans funk outfit REBIRTH BRASS BAND, superstar DJ/producer FORT KNOX FIVE and local hero music collective THE JAZZ MAFIA. 

Tickets for this once in a lifetime celebration, 20-years in the making, tickets are on sale now at www.Bimbos365club.com. and http://bit.ly/HUSHrebirthbimbos

Doors: 7:30pm| Show 8pm | 21+
title: HUSHconcerts 20th Anniversary w/ Rebirth Brass Band

description:
This show features comics who have had some run ins with the cops.  Arrests, detainments, DUI's; they've had them, and you'll laugh at their ridiculous takes of woe.

Host KC Scannell was born and raised in the beautiful bay area, kc spent his childhood surviving non-white meat chicken nuggets and absorbing as much comedy as possible.
after taking the "scenic 6-year route" through college at san diego state, he fell ass-backward into an english degree, and has worked tirelessly to make a mockery of it ever since.
in Los Angeles, he wrote for a number of comedy websites and studied sketch comedy at the infamous Upright Citizen’s Brigade theatre (UCB).

Andy Picarro- Born in Pittsburgh, PA and raised in central New Jersey. Andy began doing standup at the Comedy Village in New York City and was a regular at The Underground Lounge. Now residing in Pittsburgh, Andy regularly works at the Pittsburgh Improv and has opened for; Pauly Shore, Josh Blue, Todd Glass, Pete Davidson, Joey Diaz, Otto and George amongst many others. Andy has performed in many Comedy Festivals including; The Accidental Comedy Festival, Whiskey Bear Comedy Festival, The Derby City Comedy Festival.

Belinda Carroll- Nurtured by a Mother who told everyone she was from "the South", to avoid admitting she was a hillbilly raised in Appalachia, West Virginia; Belinda Carroll has been openly talking about the secret trashier side of life, being a queerdo, hypocrisy, and Republicans all over the country. She has written for Huffington Post, Cracked.Com, Portland Mercury, has appeared on Portlandia, Grimm, MTV and performed with people such as; Hari Kondabolu, Julie Goldman, Ron Funches.

 Jason Anderson is a comic from Sacramento, most well known for not getting his grandmother to stop bringing up that time he was on WeTV's Bridezillas.  To gain any other notoriety he took a role on HBO's Silicon Valley and led this led his grandmother to reply "What Valley?"

Pam Benjamin is the director of Mutiny Radio. She loves cheese, cats, her boyfriend, T-Rex conspiracy theories, Marxism, de kind buds, IPA and making people laugh.
title: Mutiny Radio Comedy Festival 2017: Oh My DUI!

description:
The comics will do a first set kinda sober, then they'll go outside and smoke a fatty to the face and come back in to entertain you again.  Which set will be better?  Both are sure to make you laugh.

Host Zach Wiseman is a stereotypical drifter originally from Alaska. He started comedy in the den of sin that is Las Vegas before moving to the Bay Area after 3 years in the game. Currently, 5 years in, he consistently delivers hard hitting clever jokes that are just the right kind of edgy.

Andy Picarro- Born in Pittsburgh, PA and raised in central New Jersey. Andy began doing standup at the Comedy Village in New York City and was a regular at The Underground Lounge. Now residing in Pittsburgh, Andy regularly works at the Pittsburgh Improv and has opened for; Pauly Shore, Josh Blue, Todd Glass, Pete Davidson, Joey Diaz, Otto and George amongst many others. Andy has performed in many Comedy Festivals including; The Accidental Comedy Festival, Whiskey Bear Comedy Festival, The Derby City Comedy Festival.

Alex Gimapapa- A Boston-based comic, Alex Giampapa began performing stand up at 19 and has since come to share stages with industry heavyweights like Bill Burr and Adam Devine. Alex was recently featured in The World Series of Comedy, a national stand up competition. With his unique-but-relatable style and approachable demeanor, Alex manages to make personal material reach audiences aged 9 to 99. Alex won the 4th Grade Francis Wyman Elementary School Spelling Bee and his mother is very proud.

Piper Shephard- Originally hailing from Memphis, Tennessee and having grown up around parts of rural Alabama, Piper Shepherd is a stand-up comedian, musician, and actor who is currently based out of Denver, Colorado. She has performed on stages all over the state of Colorado as well as various parts of the country since 2014.

Benjie Wright- A finalist in the 2016 Joshua Tree Comedy Festival and former radio personality, Alabama native Benjie Wright has endeared himself to a wide range of audiences with a contagious laugh and friendly, almost intoxicating demeanor. His unique outlook and quick wit has made him popular on the comedy scene giving him the opportunity to work with big names like Billy Gardell, Jon Reep, and Caroline Rhea. Benjie has akso been featured on Nashville Star, Funny or Die, and Fox.
title: Mutiny Radio Comedy Festival 2017: Soberish v Super Stoned

description:
They LOVE DRUGS, and have some crazy stories about it!

Host Kevin Wong is Easily annoyed. Enjoys kittens, puppies, and talking about himself. Been doing comedy since 2010, produces shows in the peninsula since 2014. Podcasts a solo show twice a week called "the podcast". Loves Mutiny Radio.

Joe Kelley is a very charming and lovable comedian. Originally from Flint, Michigan, he began doing comedy in Nashville, Tennessee and moved to Seattle in 2016 to find his place in the sun. He regularly tours the Southeast and participated in breaking the Guinness World Record for the longest stand up comedy show with multiple comedians as part of the Wild West Comedy Festival in 2015 and 2016.

Ben Harkins is a Pittsburgh native currently residing in Portland, Oregon. Harkins hosts Flyass Jokes, Portland’s longest running stand up showcase. His unsweetened insights and deadpan delivery have made him an audience favorite throughout the Pacific Northwest. His contentious material covers everything from the extinction of species to the price of groceries. Ben Harkins has performed at San Francisco Sketchfest, the Helium Comedy Club in Portland and headlined at the Seven Nightclub in Bend Oregon.

I'm Tony Lewis, I am a native to the Puget Sound of Washington State. I have been doing standup for 2 years mostly in the Olympia/Tacoma Scene. I've featured at World Famous Nicks and also in Olympias Pig Bar and also at Le Voyeurs weekly Vomity Open mic. I've been on the podcasts :"Everything is Awesome" and also "The Stationwagon Podcast" as well as hosted my own "The Ye Old Olympic Comedy Hour". I used to do pre-taped sketches with my group Dorsal Fin United. I have performed also at the Olympia Hempfest and took 2nd place at the Northwest Cannabis Comedy Competition.

Host Jesus u Betta Work- Get ready for the 100% real-fruit comedy of Jesús U. BettaWork! With a blood type of espresso, Jesús has an energy that'll put the electric company out of business! He has performed at San Francisco's Punchline, Tommy T's, Tourettes Without Regrets in Oakland, and numerous bars and cafes where he ends up being the special of the day. To find out the skinny latte on Jesús get your log on at www.jesusubettawork.com. Yaaaas!

Pervert Fervor- I know you crave me. Yes, I too have been waiting for this for quite some time.  There is so much back and forth, time spent patching things together for you, you wondering where the hell I’ve been.  Why I’ve been? I am in here, Silly. I am thinking of you, always. I like the build up, the anxiousness that twirls in my abdomen, then that moment when you see what I’m gonna do. It all comes down to that. I start pulling things and inserting other things and twisting it a little sometimes. You’re going move back and forth, up and down, side to side… with me … and all of us.  Just be nervous, for me.  And when it’s over you can do what ever you want to it. It’s for you. Soundcloud.com/PervertFervor

Journey Roberts drive to reframe her contempt as good will has equally disquieted and enthralled unwitting drunks in 3 states. Unable to examine pleasant subjects she has recently started ignoring the human aversion to reality and instead focuses on a hospice care approach to what other people consider opinions. If you wish to baffle this ornery bus dweller ask her what got her into comedy and enjoy glazed befuddlement spread over her community college drop out face as she tries to recreate what you might think a superior occupation to telling jokes to drunks for a living.

JEFF YOUNG has been performing across the country to rave reviews. His memorable cadence, dark outlook, and thoughtful material combined with his loveable and vulnerable personality, leaves audiences laughing, then scratching their heads at the disassociated absurdity of his act. Equally popular with mature and youth audiences, YOUNG takes on tough topics like family and politics, juxtaposing them with bizarre observations of pop culture and existence. Based in NYC, YOUNG has been featured on Gotham Comedy Live, The World Series of Comedy, Amateur Night at the Apollo and is a regular at clubs including The Stand in NYC, The Comedy Studio in Boston and Comedy Connection in Providence.

He performs Improv and stand up comedy and has played on some of biggest stages in Los Angeles including the Comedy Store and Viper Room Main Stage shows. He’s also had numerous articles published by Huffington Post. He currently resides in Portland Oregon and tours the country doing standup.

Clay Newman- This joke slinging rabble rouser has been delighting audiences across the country for the past 5 years with his tales of life, love, and all that other crap that fills up our days. Also a member of the Screen Actors Guild, Clay can be seen portraying a wide range of characters in local and national commercials from pot head, to techie, to techie pot head. For clips and info on upcoming shows check out ClayNewmanComedy.com

description:
FACE X Public Works Present:

2ManyDJ's

+ Eug

+ in the Loft
Vin Sol ( Soo Wavey / Club Lonely )
Bézier ( Honey  Soundsystem )
Guillaume ( Spring Theory )

Funktion One sound

From politically incorrect prog-rock to funky r&b, from trendy hiptrop to banging German techno, ja: if it gets a booty going, the Dewaele brothers have it in their record collection.

In times where moms give their sons and daughters DJ-courses for their birthdays and bootlegging has become an Olympic sport, it is nice to see a record that sets a new standard in the genre of mix-albums: '2 Many DJ's' from Belgian groove-gurus Soulwax.

Fans of quality left-of-centre rock music will know Soulwax from their highly acclaimed album 'Much Against Everyone's Advice', which made it into the British Top 40 and got rave responses in Japan and Australia. But there's much more to the two brothers than meets the eye. Apart from being chairman of the Belgian Carpenters Association (Stephen) and having a black belt in tae kwon do (David), they are also masters in blending the finest products of music history together into a catchy, hilarious and -above all- intriguing groove exploration. From politically incorrect prog-rock to funky r&b, from trendy hiptrop to banging German techno, ja: if it gets a booty going, the Dewaele brothers have it in their record collection. 

Blending beautiful tunes is far from new for the Soulwax brothers. Back in the dark days of 1999, David and Stephen started a DJ-show on Belgian national radio, called 'Hang The DJ', where they did exactly that. Years before bootlegging reached the trendy pages of The Face, they were already making their own mixes for inclusion on the show. Inspired by the philosophy of one Grandmaster Flash, they cut together the best bits of funky tracks into an even funkier mix. It was then that classic mixes of Blackstreet with Grandmaster Flash, Beck with Prodigy and Beastie Boys vs. Herbie Hancock with INXS vs. AC/DC saw the light of day. Praise the Lord.

After having wooed Belgian and Dutch crowds for a few years with these eclectic sets, they went on to impress the most cynical part of the world, the London scene, a loud yet harmless species. The British capital, where approximately 67% of the population (including 17% of women over 65) owns two decks and a mixer, is used to a thing or two, but Stephen and David immediately raised quite a few eyebrows with sparkling sets for London's independent radio station Xfm, national institution BBC Radio 1 and appearances at the renowned Trash nights in London and Arthur Baker's Sunday Sessions in The Elbow Room.

Impact on the trendometer: a fat 9.5. "When we played our first set for Xfm", says David, "several club owners phoned up during the transmission to ask us to come and play their venues." And when an (unnamed) DJ played Soulwax's classic bootleg mix of Skee-Lo's 'I Wish', Survivor's 'Eye Of The Tiger' and The Breeders' 'Cannonball' at a London club night and pretended he was mixing it himself, it became official: Soulwax was hot property. Even Jarvis Cocker showed his appreciation for their skills and none other than über-producer Felix Da Housecat invited the brothers to collaborate on his new project: a girlband called Glamarama. You gotta believe it…

No surprise then that '2 Many DJ's' has been in the pipeline for yonks, but because getting tracks cleared is a legal war zone, it has taken quite a bit longer. "Mick Jones from The Clash was very impressed with our bootleg version of their 'The Magnificent Seven' mixed with Basement Jaxx's 'Romeo'", explains Stephen, "but still we didn't manage to secure the rights to include it on the album". Rumours that two lawyers have been decapitated since are unconfirmed.
Too bad, but there's more than enough magic material to keep you intrigued, smiling and shaking. The record includes already renowned mixes like Destiny's Child's 'Independent Women' with 10CC's 'Dreadlock Holiday' and Stooges' 'No Fun' with Salt 'N' Pepa's 'Push It', but it also features new beautiful blends like Röyksopp's 'Eple' with Dolly Parton's 'Nine To Five' and Basement Jaxx's 'Where's Your Head At' with Emerson Lake & Palmer's 'Theme From Peter Gun'. 

Tongue-in-cheek is the first thing that springs to mind when reading these names, but if you peel off the first, obvious layer, you have to admit that these 'cheesy' mixes actually do work. Mixing 45 songs together in one hour of music is one thing. But making that hour a consistent exploration of the history of pop music is quite another. '2 Many DJ's' makes you laugh, yes indeed, but it also covers left, right, top and bottom of groovy pop. Some of the tracks on this album are obvious classics, some are simply unknown and some will very soon become hot sought-after gems. From Japanese geisha Hanayo covering 'Joe le Taxi', 21st century proof electro from Adult., Finnish disco from Ural 13 Diktators or sleazy Peaches to classics from The Velvet Underground, The Breeders, The Residents, Sly And The Family Stone and Nena. They're all there for a reason. 
'2 Many DJ's' proves that 'genre' has never been such a naff word.
title: 2ManyDJ's : Presented by FACE & Public Works Friday March 3

TICKETS UPDATE: All VIP Tickets are and Saturday General Admission Tickets are SOLD OUT! Remaining tickets include only Sunday General Admission at this time. Get your tickets today before they're gone: http://devourphoenix.com/classic/tickets/

*******

The Devour Culinary Classic is the region’s premier week long annual culinary celebration hosted at several distinct venues in Phoenix, AZ. The goal of the events are to showcase celebrity culinary talent, the fine food and drink producers and purveyors of Arizona while furthering metro Phoenix as a dining destination worthy of international prestige.

The 2017 Devour Culinary Classic presented by Local First Arizona, Devour Phoenix, Phoenix Art Museum, and Southern Arizona Arts & Cultural Alliance. 

The Devour Culinary Classic features culinary curators and purveyors who support the Arizona food, wine and restaurant industries. Attendees will have the chance to partake in innovative culinary demonstrations, meet top chefs and restaurateurs as well as taste an enormous array of culinary excellence from the region’s best chefs, restaurants, local food artisans, brewers, and vintners. The Devour Culinary Classic is founded on the idea that food can bring people together. As James Beard once said, “food is common ground for all people, a universal experience.”

Enjoy Devour Week by joining us at any of the Devour Culinary Classic pre-events, tickets on sale now: 
Feb 26: Devour Phoenix Bartending Competition
March 1: Seven Chef Singh Along
March 2: Palette to Palate
March 3: Devour Week Film Screening: Elements

More information is available at http://devourphoenix.com/classic/.

description:
A Media & Entertainment Convention for LGBTQ Women and Allies.

3 DAYS . 1000's OF WOMEN . 20+ COUNTRIES
ACTRESSES . FILMMAKERS . AUTHORS
ARTISTS . MUSICANS . YOUTUBERS
VENDORS . COMICS & MORE!

To Connect
​
ClexaCon provides a platform to build community, bringing together a diverse group of LGBTQ fans and content creators from around the world. Networking events will connect filmmakers, actors and industry professionals while panels, workshops, and autograph sessions will connect creators with fans. 
 
To Empower

ClexaCon aims to empower media creators to produce and distribute more positive LGBTQ content, providing educational resources for the community to aid in the push for better representation. ClexaCon will strive to lay the foundation for improved visibility within the media while encouraging more LGBTQ women to participate in creating the stories they desire. 
Our convention gathers writers, directors, and actors who create, portray, and support LGBT+ communities through their work and lives. We also feature LGBT+ focused panels with journalists, media experts, and industry professionals who further the conversation on the issues that affect queer women in the media.

For more information: www.clexacon.com
Tickets: www.clexacon.com/tickets

21+ Events:

The Optional Badge Pick Up Party (to avoid the Friday morning line):
ClexaCon Presents: Badge Pick Up Party

The Official Afterparty:
ClexaCon Presents: Sinful - Saturday Night in Las Vegas

description:
My favorite comics of the festival kill it on the 2nd to last show!

Host Pam BenjaminBelinda Carroll - Nurtured by a Mother who told everyone she was from "the South", to avoid admitting she was a hillbilly raised in Appalachia, West Virginia; Belinda Carroll has been openly talking about the secret trashier side of life, being a queerdo, hypocrisy, and Republicans all over the country. She has written for Huffington Post, Cracked.Com, Portland Mercury, has appeared on Portlandia, Grimm, MTV and performed with people such as; Hari Kondabolu, Julie Goldman, Ron Funches.

Reid Clark

Reid Clark gave up his right testicle for comedy. Literally. He talks about it in his set, it’s funny yet uncomfortable like a lot of Reid’s humor. His comedy has been described as dark, blue, and political, with elements of musicality and improvisation. Reid has been doing comedy for 5 years but has been performing his whole life. He has opened for Alonzo Bodden, Neal Brennan, and Trevor Noah at Dead Crow Comedy Room in his home town of Wilmington, North Carolina. Reid also has improv, sketch and writing experience. Reid has written original stage and screen plays and has written jokes for actor Orlando Jones. Reid has written, directed and performed for music videos that have been in film festivals.  Reid has starred in the film Frat Brothers available on Netflix. He has also been the lead in an episode of Fatal Encounters on Discovery ID. Over the past few months Reid has been traveling doing comedy in Denver, San Antonio and currently in Washington DC. Reid has been in the Cape Fear Comedy Festival, a three time finalist in Port City’s Top Comic and a finalist this year of the Funniest In South Texas Comedy Competition at Laugh Out Loud Comedy Club in San Antonio.

Ben Harkins is a Pittsburgh native currently residing in Portland, Oregon. Harkins hosts Flyass Jokes, Portland’s longest running stand up showcase. His unsweetened insights and deadpan delivery have made him an audience favorite throughout the Pacific Northwest. His contentious material covers everything from the extinction of species to the price of groceries. Ben Harkins has performed at San Francisco Sketchfest, the Helium Comedy Club in Portland and headlined at the Seven Nightclub in Bend Oregon.

Journey Roberts drive to reframe her contempt as good will has equally disquieted and enthralled unwitting drunks in 3 states. Unable to examine pleasant subjects she has recently started ignoring the human aversion to reality and instead focuses on a hospice care approach to what other people consider opinions. If you wish to baffle this ornery bus dweller ask her what got her into comedy and enjoy glazed befuddlement spread over her community college drop out face as she tries to recreate what you might think a superior occupation to telling jokes to drunks for a living.

Faisal Alam:  Despite his legal background working domestic violence cases, Faisal Alam is reviled by the women of the New York Comedy Scene as well as the rest of the community. Faisal's comedy has been compared to many things, but never to comedy. He is the subject of a Change.org petition to quit and you should all sign it.
title: Mutiny Radio Comedy Festival: Best of the FEST

description:
Sparkle Jesus will be on stage to be roasted by these comics!  BBQing Jesus all Sunday!

Host David Roth- David is one half of the comedy/production team Destiny's Mom that's produced dozens of sold out shows all across the Bay Area. This past year, he performed stand-up at Outside Lands and SF Sketchiest, wrote jokes performed by SNL's Colin Jost and Michael Che, and was prominently featured in The SF Weekly.  David has written two Super Bowl commercials and collaborated with comedy legends like Bob Odenkirk, Larry Charles, and Jim Gaffigan. David also co-wrote a song with Sir Mix A Lot, who refers to him as “The guy that tried to ruin my career.”

Scott Kidd is not your typical comedian. He hails from Cajun Louisiana and is quite spicy! Burning opponents in joke competitions, keeping it hot and steamy on stage, and sizzling audiences with his unique sensibilities. From the Funny Bone, to the Hollywood Improv, Scott keeps the crowd on the edge of their seat with amazing impressions, original music, deep cutting sharp wit, and spectacular stage presence. Though he's modest and humble, Scott Kidd has made appearances with Death Squad, Bad News Weekly, Roastbattle, Jay and Silent Bob, Dolph Lundgren, Idiotest, and many more! His latest contribution to comedy, is the new hit series, "Jack Jimminy : Porn Star Extra" from the universe of Dromebox Labs. He can warm your heart or light your ass on fire!

Faisal Alam- Despite his legal background working domestic violence cases, Faisal Alam is reviled by the women of the New York Comedy Scene as well as the rest of the community. Faisal's comedy has been compared to many things, but never to comedy. He is the subject of a Change.org petition to quit and you should all sign it.

Mike Sjerven moved to the Bay Area in 2016 from Denver, CO where he was a regular at the prestigious Comedy Works comedy clubs. He has performed at Red Rocks Amphitheater and has toured the United States extensively. He has also written about Denver sports for SB Nation.

Martin Lendahls Originally from Sweden, Martin spent a lifetime collecting embarrassing and potentially crippling experiences. He's been making up for a happy childhood by grave digging in Sweden, being a male escort in London, animator in San Francisco and stay-at-home-dad in Portland, each one scarring in its own unique way.
title: Mutiny Radio Comedy Festival: Roast of Jesus

description:
GLAS ANIMATION FESTIVAL 2017

GLAS Animation Festival 2017 is on its way! GLAS takes place March 2-5, 2017 in the historic city of Berkeley, California, just a quick ride away from San Francisco. GLAS introduces new ideas and expands the scope of animation by bringing new voices, new talents, new themes, and a new generation of independent filmmakers and curators to the United States. We highlight fresh voices in independent animation while curating special programs of the most significant periods of animation history that serve as an inspiration for contemporary animators.

At GLAS Animation Festival we have a complete short film competition program as well as retrospectives, special curated programs, Q&As, behind the scene screenings and panels, animation installations and more. GLAS Animation Festival unites the animation community with the Berkeley and Bay Area community, sharing great and unique animated works from around the world.

Passes on sale now! 
http://www.glasanimation.com/passes/

For more information about passes, lodging, volunteering, sponsorship, check out our website.
http://www.glasanimation.com

Lineup to be announced soon!
title: GLAS Animation Festival 2017

On Sale Now!

$15 // Doors at 7pm // 18+

To hear MAKO now is to witness them at a creative crossroads, a trip four years in the making for producer/songwriter/vocalist Alex Seaver and producer Logan Light. Following their rapid rise, MAKO now tackle a new sonic challenge via their debut album Hourglass, out now!

A stark shift in musical aesthetic, Hourglass sees MAKO graduating beyond their early beginnings in dance music and reaching far into the spheres of pop, indie rock and beyond. The album, created over two years, reflects an equal amalgamation of the myriad influences from which Seaver and Light draw as well as their deep-rooted experience on the road, in the studio, on the stage and in everyday life. All together, Hourglass is the latest and most robust chapter in the MAKO storyline, a growing tale told up to date in the album’s 12 tracks.
title: MAKO

Space lovers and star gazers are in for a treat during this Explore Arizona: Starry Night evening at Usery Park. During the two hour event, adventurers will hear from astronomers and use telescopes while learning about the planets, moon and stars.

Everyone will receive a sky map for the month of January and staff will teach you how to use it. Possible photos of the moon, Jupiter or Saturn through the telescope,  if visible, will be taken.  Guests can also win awesome XAZ prizes during a game of "Stargazing Jeopardy."

The "Traveling Stargazing Store" will be on site as well.  The store sells educational and fun stargazing related products such as books, bookmarks, stargazing aides, constellation mugs, space related candy (Milky Way bars, Moon Pies) and much more. 

What you need to know:
- Cost is $11 
- Children are welcome - 17 years old and under are FREE!
-  ADA Compliant
- No dogs
- $6 parking fee - funds are given directly to park facilities (separate from ticket price) 
- The parking lot is small. Carpooling is highly recommended 

What you should bring:
- Camping chairs
- Blankets
- Binoculars
- Flashlights

Tickets typically sell out quickly. Dress warmly and we'll see you underneath the stars!

description:
Save the date for the 8th annual Great American Barbecue & Beer Festival returns on Saturday, March 25, 2017 to fill the downtown Chandler air with the sweet aroma of BBQ pork, beef, chicken and ribs. 

Festival highlights include a full day of country music, 60 BBQ pit masters, craft beer, March Madness lounge, grilling demonstrations, a kids zone, eating competition zone and over 100 exhibitors. 

Presale general admission tickets are available for $15 online at www.chandlerbbq.com and will be $20 at the gate day of. 

Food and beverages are sold separately. Children 12 years of age and younger are admitted for free. All valley Bashas’ locations will have discounted $10 admission ticket available beginning in February.

Winner of Outstanding Event of the Year in 2012 and 2013 at the APS AzTEC Awards, the 2017 Great American Barbecue & Beer Festival will be the biggest and best year yet with expanded event zones, more than 100 exhibitors, and over 60 Pit Masters from across the nation serving up over 20,000 lbs of mouth-watering pork ribs, pulled pork, brisket and chicken, all paired with the state’s finest craft beer.
​
A portion of the event proceeds will benefit the Boot Campaign, a 501(c)(3) dedicated to providing assistance to wounded military and their families with job placement and securing mortgage free homes, post traumatic stress disorder counseling, adaptive clothing and much more. For more information about the Boot Campaign, visit www.bootcampaign.com.
title: 2017 Great American BBQ & Beer Festival

description:
(2017 Las Vegas EB-5 & Investment Immigration Convention pictured above)






2017 San Francisco EB-5 & Investment Immigration Convention

July 27-28, 2017

Westin St. Francis

San Francisco, California

EB5 Investors Magazine is pleased to announce that our second domestic event of 2017 will take place at the Westin St. Francis in the gorgeous city of San Francisco, California. On July 27-28, we will host a gathering of top migration agencies, immigration attorneys, EB-5 industry professionals, regional centers, and developers at the 2017 San Francisco EB-5 & Investment Immigration Convention.

The convention will feature educational panels moderated by EB-5 program experts, workshops for attorneys and regional centers, special guest speeches, and exhibitor opportunities. We invite anyone interested in learning about the EB-5 program and increasing their industry exposure to join us at the 2017 San Francisco EB-5 & Investment Immigration Convention. Beginners and experts alike will convene, network, and discuss EB-5 industry updates in one convenient location.

In a city that embodies the successes of cross-cultural partnerships, participants of the EB-5 Convention can learn from the best, showcase their businesses, and connect with influencers in the EB-5 industry. Stay tuned for more information on this exciting event. For inquiries regarding sponsorship and speaking opportunities, contact our team today at: info@eb5investors.com

Who Will Attend the 2017 San Francisco EB-5 & Investment Immigration Convention?


	Leading Immigration Attorneys and Service Providers
	Regional Centers/Project Developers
	Representatives from High-Level and Emerging Migration Agencies
	Wealth Managers
	Concierge Service Providers
	EB-5 Program Stakeholders

Why Attend?


	Connect with EB-5 industry influencers and experts.
	Network with representatives from global migration agencies.
	Gain knowledge from beginner and expert educational panels.
	Showcase your business to a high-profile gathering of EB-5 industry stakeholders.

Enhance Your EB-5 Network

EB5 Investors Magazine events are designed to foster collaboration in the EB-5 industry. Our 2016 New York EB-5 Convention welcomed more than 700 attendees, 73 sponsors, and migration agents from around the globe.

With our 2017 conference calendar featuring events in Vietnam (March) and Beijing (May), and prior events held in locales such as Shenzhen, Guangzhou, and Shanghai, we have established a strong network of international attendees.

Our past keynote speakers have included U.S. Sen. Rand Paul (R-KY), and U.S. Representatives Bob Goodlatte (R-VA), Will Hurd (R-TX), Darrell Issa (R-CA), Hakeem Jeffries (D-NY), Jared Polis (D-CO), Dana Rohrabacher (R-CA), Ed Royce (R-CA), and Lamar Smith (R-TX).



Disclaimer: EB5Investors.com events and conferences are open to the general public and may include persons resident in the U.S. or foreign countries who may be interested in EB-5 investment opportunities. Attendees, exhibitors and speakers at our events and conferences should consult with their own legal counsel regarding compliance with securities laws for any ongoing or planned securities offerings. EB5investors.com provides no legal advice concerning compliance with securities laws by attendees, exhibitors and speakers at its conferences and events.
title: 2017 San Francisco EB-5 & Investment Immigration Convention

description: You need CLE/CE credits and we are here to help you! The Construction Defect & Dispute Conferences provide regional conferences to help you cut travel costs, time commitments and make it easier for you to get those credits. An even better way to earn those credits and build up a more impressive reputation and resume is by presenting at our conferences and earning teaching credits. These credits vary by your state bar requirements and we will help you along the way! We are looking for topics related to Construction Defects and/or Property Insurance Disputes to be presented to construction and insurance attorneys, insurance adjusters, judges, paralegals and other professionals associated with construction defects and insurance disputes for the purpose of CLE/CE credits. Courses will be based on 1 hour increments. We currently have 5 upcoming conferences for you to choose from: August 18, 2016 | 2nd Annual Midwest CDDC | Minneapolis, MN October 13, 2016 | 2nd Annual Southeast CDDC | New Orleans, LA November 11, 2016 | 2nd Annual Northwest CDDC | Seattle, WA January 12, 2016 | 2nd Annual Southwest CDDC | Las Vegas, NV February 7, 2016 | 3rd Annual Intermountain CDDC | Salt Lake City, UT All presenters selected will be given free admission (for themselves, plus up to 4 others) to the conference. We do not provide travel, hotel, or other costs. Each presenter will be invited to a Speakers Dinner the night before the conference for themselves plus a guest. We only have a limited number of spots for each conference and are looking for the best of the best so get us your topic ideas today!Submit your presentation topicIf you have questions or would like to discuss other options, please contact Jeff at 801. 641.8304 or jeff@adviseandconsult.net
title: CDDC Call for Presenters

** Please note that this show is 18+

Tickets for both nights are SOLD OUT - Thank You!

Watch THE CHAINSMOKERS:
https://www.youtube.com/user/THECHAINSMOKERS

Listen to THE CHAINSMOKERS:
https://soundcloud.com/thechainsmokers

About THE CHAINSMOKERS:
GRAMMY®-nominated artist/producer duo The Chainsmokers left it up to their fans to decide whether or not they’d release an album, and the clamor has been heard across the world. In response to popular demand, the duo has announced that they will release their debut album this year via Columbia / Disruptor Records.

The album and tour announcements come hot on the heels of the release of The Chainsmokers’ brand new single “Paris.” The song, which USA TODAY notes “has all the makings of their next huge hit,” immediately shot to the #1 spot on iTunes’ Top Songs chart upon release and debuted at #7 on Billboard’s Hot 100, marking the duo’s fourth track to reach the Top 10 and their highest first week entrance on the chart to date. The Chainsmokers are up for three GRAMMY® Awards this year in the Best New Artist, Best Pop Duo/Group Performance (“Closer” Featuring Halsey) and Best Dance Recording (“Don’t Let Me Down” Featuring Daya) categories.
title: The Chainsmokers at Bill Graham Civic Auditorium

with Elujay

HONNE are singer Andy and multi-instrumentalist James, who first bonded over their shared upbringing in South-West England; then, the more evocative, US West Coast grooves of their record collections, and a mutual fascination with Japan. During a midnight re-watching of Lost in Translation, it became apparent that this sense of a partner at a loose end - of wandering through a strange environment, and struggling to convey what you mean - was just as relevant to their lives off-screen. When James found the word ‘Honne’ later on (a Japanese phrase meaning ‘true feelings’), the boys knew it was theirs.
title: HONNE

description:
Elton John and his band return to Tucson for one performance at Tucson Arena on Tuesday, March 21, 2017 at 8 PM as part of an 11-city concert tour that will feature iconic hits and classic album tracks from throughout his incredible five-decade career, as well as selected tracks from his latest release, Wonderful Crazy Night.

The public on-sale will begin Monday, December 5 at 10 a.m.

“The simple truth is I want to spend more time with my family and less time touring,” said Elton. “I am all too aware of how precious the time ahead is. My sons are growing up so quickly. Their early years are just flying by and I want to be there with them”.

Elton John’s band features Nigel Olsson (part of Elton’s original three-piece band) on drums, Davey Johnstone (who first recorded with Elton in 1971 and joined the band a year later) on guitar, John Mahon on percussion, Kim Bullard on keyboards and Matt Bissonette on bass.

One of the most successful artists on the road today, Elton and his band perform a concert you will never forget: the entire audience singing along to much-loved classic songs such as “Your Song”, “Rocket Man”, “Bennie and the Jets”, “Philadelphia Freedom”, “Crocodile Rock”, “Don’t Let the Sun Go Down on Me”, and many more.

“It is truly an honor to welcome back Sir Elton John to the Tucson Arena for what will be an incredible performance,” said Glenn Grabski, General Manager of the TCC.

The monumental career of international singer/songwriter and performer Elton John spans five decades. He is one of the top-selling solo artists of all time with 38 gold records and 31 platinum albums, 29 consecutive Top 40 hits, and he has sold more than 250 million records worldwide. John holds the record for the biggest selling single of all time, “Candle in the Wind ’97,” which sold over 37 million copies. Since launching his first tour in 1970, he has played over 4,000 concerts worldwide in more than 80 countries to his credit.

Buy tickets at the Tucson Convention Center Ticket Office any Ticketmaster locations, www.ticketmaster.com or charge by phone 800-745-3000. Two hours prior to event tickets must be purchased at Tucson Convention Center Ticket Office.

We can only guarantee the authenticity of tickets bought from our box office or ticketmaster.com.

For additional information please call 520-791-4101 X 1.
title: Elton John & His Band: Wonderful Crazy Night Tour

THE CHAINSMOKERS will perform TWO NIGHTS at the Bill Graham CIvic Auditorium in San Francisco on Friday, May 5th and Saturday, May 6th! KIIARA, Grandtheft and Emily Warren will open the show.  

** Please note that this show is 18+

Tickets for both nights are SOLD OUT - Thank You!
 
Watch THE CHAINSMOKERS:
https://www.youtube.com/user/THECHAINSMOKERS

Listen to THE CHAINSMOKERS:
https://soundcloud.com/thechainsmokers

About THE CHAINSMOKERS:
GRAMMY®-nominated artist/producer duo The Chainsmokers left it up to their fans to decide whether or not they’d release an album, and the clamor has been heard across the world. In response to popular demand, the duo has announced that they will release their debut album this year via Columbia / Disruptor Records.

The album and tour announcements come hot on the heels of the release of The Chainsmokers’ brand new single “Paris.” The song, which USA TODAY notes “has all the makings of their next huge hit,” immediately shot to the #1 spot on iTunes’ Top Songs chart upon release and debuted at #7 on Billboard’s Hot 100, marking the duo’s fourth track to reach the Top 10 and their highest first week entrance on the chart to date.  The Chainsmokers are up for three GRAMMY® Awards this year in the Best New Artist, Best Pop Duo/Group Performance (“Closer” Featuring Halsey) and Best Dance Recording (“Don’t Let Me Down” Featuring Daya) categories.
title: The Chainsmokers at Bill Graham Civic Auditorium

The 8th Annual Waylon Run will begin at 10:00 am at Los Santos MC’s clubhouse (located at 1746 E Madison St #5 Phoenix, AZ 85034). We will have kickstands up at 11:00 am and the pack will head to the Mesa Cemetery to pay our respects to Waylon. From there, the run will continue up to Scottsdale Harley where we will have a quick lunch. After lunch we’ll ride to Chilleen’s on 17 in Black Canyon City for great food, drinks, camping, and live outlaw country music by guests Drew Cooper, Lorin Walker Madsen, The Inward Morning, and Gethen Jenkins & The FreightShakers!

Thank you to all our great sponsors who have helped us in making our 8th annual Waylon Run a success.

description:
As you may (or may not - we won’t hold that against you) have heard, BAD is bringing our roller derby home season back to Oakland! 

We’re excited to host a matchup between the San Francisco ShEvil Dead and the Oakland Outlaws for our 2017 season opener. Oakland may be home turf for the Outlaws, but ShEvil has proven they’re more than just a shambling band of rolling zombies. Who will reign supreme in this Battle of the Bay?

Doors Open: 4:00 PM
Game Time: 5:00 PM
General Admission: $15*
*Kids 7 and under free.

This year, many of our games will be played at the Historic 16th Street Station - or as we like to call it “The Station.” Located in West Oakland, this former train station has outdoor and indoor space and is accessible by public transit. 

Parking passes available for purchase online in advance, and limited on site parking is also available for $10 cash. All proceeds go back to the league to help us fund BAD operations.

We can’t wait to see you sporting glorious green attire with zombie face paint or decked from head to toe in red and black!

Questions or want to set up a group package? Please email Events@bayareaderby.com.
title: 2017 Roller Derby Season Opener: Battle of the Bay Oakland v SF

New single "New Sound" https://soundcloud.com/saveferrisband/newsound/s-4sMMN

SAVE FERRIS
Orange County ska-punks Save Ferris were a topic of mainstream success in the late '90s. They had hits on the radio, toured constantly and appeared in television shows and movies such as 10 Things I Hate About You. Now, after 15 years, they are making their long awaited return to the music scene with a brand new EP and a full U.S. tour, coming to Sacramento March 24 

"New Sound," featuring ska royalty Neville Staples of the Specials, is the first single off their upcoming EP Checkered Past available February 10, same as the kickoff date for their tour. 

VISTA KICKS 

...Chasing Waves has all the warmth, the fun, and the strife of a young band reeling from the unadulterated struggles of being twenty-somethings just trying to get by in a fucked-up twenty-first century world.." - Mitch Mosk, Atwood Magazine

Their debut EP Chasing Waves (2016) made Apple Music's Featured New Artists page and lived on the homepage of iTunes for four consecutive weeks. They've toured the US with Swim Deep, and now they're touring the West Coast and Southwest this spring with Save Ferris. Vista Kicks' music is a fast blend of good ol' Rock N' Roll, Funk, and Pop. Their shows are electric, they make impossible not to dance and have a great time.
title: Save Ferris with Vista Kicks at Harlow's

description:
Edible & Medicinal Plants of the Sonoran Desert: Phoenix Area

Of the four U.S. deserts the Sonoran is the hottest and most arid, but it ALSO happens to be the most botanically diverse…being home to a large number of edible, medicinal, and utilitarian plants. The spring bloom period, before the searing heat of summer sets in, is the IDEAL time to explore this majestic landscape of valleys, riparian canyons, and desert mountains. Join us as we learn about a wide variety of useful plants (both common and obscure) found growing in the spectacular wild lands found just outside the city limits. Historical and modern medicinal applications will be covered along with any edible and/or utilitarian potential. Tips on basic/intermediate plant identification will be offered with a special emphasis on plant family characteristics as well as differentiating poisonous look-alike plants from their beneficial counterparts. 

-SPRING SESSION-

Phoenix, AZ. Saturday, March 18. 10am-4pm. $47 

Instructor: Tellur Fenner of the Blue Wind School of Botanical Studies.

Make sure to bring: Water, lunch, notebook, hat/sunscreen, rain gear, and a camera.

Class will occur RAIN OR SHINE! :)

Registration: Email (preferred): bluewindbmc@gmail.com

Pre-registration is required to secure your spot. 

Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/bluewindschool/

You can find out more about our other statewide classes/programs by subscribing to our class email list (which looks a lot like an official website) here: http://eepurl.com/cuG-7r

Scope out our photo/video feed on Instagram:
https://www.instagram.com/bluewindschool/

Phone: 510-290-6841

Interested but don't have a car? Inquire about carpooling options.

Looking for a more substantial/comprehensive (desert focused) edible/medicinal plant learning experience? If so, scope out the following 60 hour program that I'll be offering March-May 2017. Guaranteed to be QUITE the floristic adventure!

https://www.facebook.com/events/710781722400053/
title: Edible & Medicinal Plants of the Sonoran Desert: Phoenix Area

description:
"One of the best live soul bands I have ever seen!" – Al Bell (Record producer, songwriter, executive, and co-owner of legendary Stax Records)

Raised amid the rich musical culture and history of the San Francisco Bay Area, Monophonics proudly carry the torch through the generations into today's musical landscape. Holding on to tradition, but by no means purists of any kind, they play their own brand of music known as "Psychedelic Soul."

The 2012 release of Monophonics last album In Your Brain saw the band pulling influences from such acts as early Funkadelic, Sly and The Family Stone and the The Temptation's Norman Whitfield produced records. With the new album, Sound of Sinning (out now on Transistor Sound Records), the band has grown in all areas of record making and felt a need to explore other important influences. While the group has come to cherish these inspirations, with Sound of Sinning they started venturing beyond, to the groups that were inspiring those soul acts to embrace the psychedelic sound of the 60's and 70's. Bands such as The Zombies, The Beatles, Beach Boys and Pink Floyd. Even with the experimentation of new musical territory, they display the sound that people know and love about Monophonics. Touching on Northern soul, doo-wop, rock and roll, Psych pop, and cinematic music, Monophonics show off their diversity while remaining true to their roots. Overall it's heartfelt music and old school vibes, without losing sight of the present. This is music steeped in that timeless feeling when people could write and produce songs that you could listen to over and over again. Sound of Sinning was produced by Kelly Finnigan & Ian McDonald and recorded on an old Tascam eight-track 1/4" tape machine at Transistor Sound Studios in San Rafael, CA.

Monophonics is Austin Bohlman (Drums), Myles O'Mahony (Bass/Background Vocals), Ian McDonald (Guitar/Background Vocals), Ryan Scott (Trumpet/Back- ground Vocals/Percussion) & Kelly Finnigan (Keys/Lead Vocals) along with a rotating 2nd horn usually filled by Nadav Nirenberg (Trombone) from Ikebe Shakedown and Breakdown Brass.
title: Monophonics & Orgōne at The UC Theatre

description:
Future Fires & The Midway Present:

Luminary: Art, Tech, Music
Featuring: SHIGETO

Luminary, a first-of-its-kind Bay Area event premieres on March 18, 2017 at The Midway, offering a unique and immersive live experience. Explore the visionary work of creators and musicians from around the world using emerging technologies: immersive audio, drones, VR, projection mapping, and more.

Future Fires and The Midway are thrilled to announce this groundbreaking collaboration, the first in an ongoing series. Luminary presents the emerging domain of code-based art in a spacious environment, showcasing brilliant music and installation pieces from local and international creators. Featured musical artist is Shigeto, whose music "carries searing emotion and is cross-wired of a host of different musical influences.” (Pitchfork). Experience three dimensional spatial audio in Envelop's 32 speaker sound system, featuring live music created by one it's founders, Christopher Willits, and other special guests. 

Artists-in-residence Can Buyukberber and Yagmur Uyanik premiere a stunning, large-scale projection-mapped piece in the Midway Gallery. Experience performances and exhibitions representing a wide range of genres throughout the evening.

More information and tickets: futurefires.com/luminary

description:
This is training to become a great presenter and speaker. It is designed to help you become more confident and effective in front of any group for any occasion, lose your fear of public speaking and transform into a great communicator.

We will cover 25 areas that will help you become the most effective communicator in your office or at any event.

Presenting and speaking is not the same thing as a SPEECH maker. A presenter/speaker communicates ideas, creates connection and leads people.

I will teach you how to make your audience feel comfortable. How to win them over to an idea. How to make a connection with your audience no matter how small or how large.

We will meet twice a month for two hours from January 14th through April 29th. You will learn 25 proven techniques to help you grow and become a great speaker. This is a very small group setting designed to help you make your mark on every audience you present to whether it's the PTA, your office or a major event.

This training will teach you how to connect with your audience and will expand your skills so you feel more confident and comfortable in front of people.

I have been training and speaking for over 40 years and taught college speaking courses for seven years. Now is your time to become a great speaker.

Watch my YouTube video  https://youtu.be/Cy4xLvjrmGU

Let's grow together.
title: Steve Sapato's Professional Speakers Academy

description:
This program is designed for HR, OD and Consulting / Coaching professionals to become certified and licensed to deliver Polarity Thinking™ processes and apply our most advanced tools including the Polarity Assessment™. This course blends our Foundations in PACT™ and Advanced Applications in PACT™ Courses, and has no pre-requisites.

In today's world of increasing interdependency and complexity, it is vital to utilize problem solving AND both/and thinking to address your most strategic challenges and opportunities. The research is clear - leaders, teams and organizations that leverage Polarities well outperform those that don't. Discover how to leverage your most strategic Polarities (AKA paradox, wicked problems, chronic tensions, dilemmas, etc.) to become more innovative, agile, profitable and competitive immediately and over time. Learn more about the Polarity Approach in this video.

Program Details
3 Day Workshop IntensiveTwo 2-hour Facilitated Webinars4 hours 1-1 Coaching and Mentoring on First Client Projects394 Page Consultant Guidebook1 Year Consultant Access to the Polarity Resource Portal

Desired Outcomes


	Clearly understand and describe what polarities are and how they work in human systems


	Distinguish problems to solve from polarities to leverage


	Become familiar with common polarities in the business literature


	Learn and apply the 5-Step S.M.A.L.L. process for leveraging polarities:
	
		
		Seeing - appreciate complex challenges and opportunities and see more of the whole reality
		
		
		Mapping - identify your desired results, values, and fears related to your most strategic Polarities with the Polarity Map®
		
		
		Assessing - use the Polarity Assessment to gather information from key stakeholders, team members, employees, etc.
		
		
		Learning – make meaning from assessment results, gaining insight into current strengths and vulnerabilities
		
		
		Leveraging – develop quality Action Steps and measurable Early Warnings to help achieve your preferred future faster and more sustainably
		
	
	


	Learn how leaders, teams, and organization systems get hooked and stuck in Polarity tensions, and the process for getting unstuck
title: Foundations & Advanced Applications in PACT™

description:
The Museum of Walking (MoW) presents theWALK, a one-thousand person contemplative walk and fundraiser happening on Saturday, March 18, 2017 from 7AM-11AM in Phoenix, AZ at the Rio Salado Habitat Restoration Area located at 2439 S Central Avenue.

theWALK is the inaugural fundraising event for the Museum of Walking talking place at the Rio Salado Habitat Restoration Area, a former landfill now home to burrowing owls, beaver, over 200 bird species, and lush vegetation in downtown Phoenix, Arizona. Focusing on the everyday activity of walking and listening, this 90-minute walk presents an opportunity for the public to experience a culturally and historically significant site with one thousand other people moving together in a mindful way through public space. theWALK encourages contemplation of the cultural and historical significance of the Rio Salado site through meaningful community engagement, public health, wellness, and sustainability awareness.

All proceeds generated by theWALK directly benefit the work of the Museum of Walking including museum exhibitions, artist honorariums, research, artist-led mindful walks, community partnerships, social engagement, and outreach. Additionally, partial proceeds will go to Native American Connections and The Phoenix Indian School Legacy Project.

Please join in supporting the only museum in the United States of America solely dedicated to the act of walking.

Visit www.mowthewalk.org to buy a ticket or 20-person wave, become a sponsor, donate, or volunteer for the event.
title: TheWALK

San Francisco’s
Summer of Love 50th Anniversary
CONCERT
June 4th 2017
Polo Fields 
Golden Gate Park, San Francisco, CA 
 
What:                         50th Anniversary of the Summer of Love, San Francisco
When:                        June 4, 2017
Where:                       Polo Fields, Golden Gate Park, San Francisco, CA
Admission:                Free
Times:                        9am to 7pm
Promoted by:            2b1 Multimedia Inc and the Council of Light, (415) 870-5312                        
Non-Profit:                NBPF Inc, a 501(c)(3), a tax-exempt organization
Web Site:                  50thsummeroflove.com
Facebook:                50th Anniversary Summer of Love
                                  https://www.facebook.com/groups/50SOL/
 
Press Contacts:          Delphia Arrowood-Barsotti PR, (707) 542-6707
                                    J.C. Juanis Media Relations, (510) 273-2490
 
The Summer of Love is a celebration of the original “Human Be-In” held in San Francisco in 1967 promoting the principles of Peace, Love and Compassion.  This event is considered by many to be the birth of the counter-culture and the spark that ignited the 60’s Hip movement; which took the world by storm. Presidents were impeached and wars were stopped, a sea of humanity stood up and said “Hell No”. This pivotal moment was the start of many earth-shattering events and a mass spiritual awakening that inspired the Peace Movement, Anti-War Movement, The Environmental Movements, Gay Rights Movement, Women’s Liberation Movement etc all having their start and taking hold during this period.


On June 4th, in San Francisco’s Polo Fields, there will be 21 bands, 32 speakers, Native American Indians, Tibetan Monks, all performing for FREE celebrating this spiritual awakening that shattered perceptions and made the world take notice.  
 <3 <3 <3 All are welcome - Admission FREE. <3 <3 <3
title: Summer Of Love 50th. Anniversary

Tickets for all three nights are SOLD OUT - Thank You!

Listen to DEADMAU5:
https://soundcloud.com/deadmau5

Watch DEADMAU5:
https://www.youtube.com/user/deadmau5

About DEADMAU5:
Joel Zimmerman, more commonly known as deadmau5 (pronounced ‘dead mouse’), is one of the world’s most respected electronic music producers of modern times. Enjoying international chart success with his singles “Professional Griefers,” “Sofi Needs A Ladder,” “Ghosts ‘n’ Stuff” and “I Remember,” he has also released five critically acclaimed albums: > album title goes here < (which reached #1 on the Billboard Dance/Electronic Chart, #2 on the Billboard Independent Album Chart and #5 on the Billboard Digital Album Chart), 4×4=12 (recently recognized for having sold over 500,000 copies in the United States), For Lack Of A Better Name, Random Album Title and while(1<2). The multiple JUNO Award-winning and GRAMMY®-nominated artist performed at the 54th Annual GRAMMY Awards as part of its first ever telecast performance highlighting electronic music. He appeared on the cover of Rolling Stone (summer double issue, 2012), marking him as the first electronic artist to do so. His ability to push the boundaries of his talent grows at an equal rate to his fan base, which counts over 15 million over his combined social media channels. Earlier this year deadmau5 leaped into the virtual reality realm with Absolut and released a massive sample catalogue with Splice, while performing major festival plays throughout the world. Look for more exciting things to come from deadmau5 soon.
title: Deadmau5 at Fox Theater - Three Nights!

Bass Camp presents DJ/Producer Dack Janiels, Friday, April 28, at 1up, downtown Reno. Tickets $10+ tax/fees in advance.  $15.00 + tax/fees at door. 
http://basscampfest.com

Dack Janiels better known as Tanner Chung was born and raised in the bay area of Northern California. Dack comes from a background of semi pro/sponsored skateboarding and listening to excessive amounts of gangster rap as a rebellious youth. After discovering bass music, Dack set out to craft his own blend of crushing basses and gangster vibes. Dack is also co-owner/founder of the 40oz Cult a group of young Proskaters, and Djs that put music, host parties and also make clothing.

The EDM Network described Dack Janiels music as..."Listening to these disemboweling drops is essentially the equivalent of signing your soul over to the Grim Reaper" 

As graduate of Icon Collective, he was able to hone and perfect his craft as Dack has grabbed attention from bass fans all over the world for both his production and skills on the decks. With much support from some of the most influential names in the genre such as Excision, NGTMRE, Protohype, Figure, Funtcase, Trollphace, Modestep and Must Die. Dack Janiels is setting a path to wreak havoc in a city near you soon! Keep an eye out for his Freshman EP out on Firepower in early 2017.

description:
Overview:

 Basic template for writing procedures. What tools to use to determine

proper documentation. Metrics Collection and Benchmarking your

documented processes. How process documentation can be the first step in

 process improvement



Why should you Attend: 

  Technology is becoming more and more part of our daily lives, and

payroll is no exception. Payroll departments everywhere are being asking

 to do more with less and leveraging technology to do payroll tasks.

Now that day to day payroll tasks are being done with greater ease.

Payroll Professionals are being asked to have better documented

processes so new employees can be trained, or backup employees will have

 the tools to keep processes going when subject matter experts are out

of the office.



 Well documented processes also assist in continued improvement of

processes.  These webinar will give you the tools to document processes

and help evaluate that documentation for improvements in the future as

well.



Areas Covered in the Session:


	Payroll best practices how they have evolved
	Discuss in detail different types of industry benchmarks 
	Step by step process on how to start a benchmarking program for your department
	Learning the difference between process based and data based benchmarking
	How to determine best in class practices
	Learning how to determine what processes to measure and when
	What are silo's and how they hurt your business
	Details of all different types of data collection methods
	The importance of customers on your benchmarking program
	Different types of customers to evaluate in your process improvement program
	Process Documentation and how to properly complete it
	Tools to use to make sure process documentation is complete

 

Who Will Benefit:


	Payroll Professionals
	Compensation Professionals 
	HR Professionals 
	Benefit Professionals


	Instructor:


	Dayna Reum ,CPP, FPC is currently the Payroll Tax
 Manager at PetSmart Inc.  Dayna has been heavily involved in the 
payroll field over 15 years.  Starting as a payroll clerk at a small 
Tucson company, Dayna moved on to be a Payroll Team Leader at Honeywell 
Inc.  During Dayna’s time at Honeywell she obtained her FPC (Fundamental
 Payroll Certification) through the American Payroll Association.  She 
also received several merit awards for Customer Service and Acquisitions
 and Divestitures. Dayna is no stranger to teaching she has taught at 
the Metro Phoenix American Payroll Association meetings and at the 
Arizona State Payroll Conference.  Topics including Payroll Basics, 
Global/Cultural Awareness, Immigration Basics for the Payroll 
Professional, Multi-State and Local Taxation and Quality Control for 
Payroll, international and Canadian payroll.



Contact Details:

NetZealous LLC, DBA TrainHR

Phone: +1-800-385-1627

Email: support@trainhr.com
title: Creating a Payroll Manual

description:
When we invest in women, we invest in our future.
That's the spirit of the She-Conomy.

Join us for TWO amazing days to inspire, empower, and support your career! Silicon Valley Forum’s Women in Tech Festival celebrates women in tech, STEM, and business careers who work to inspire, engage, and empower other women. Since the kickoff event in 2015, the Women in Tech Festival has encouraged women - and men who support the advancement of women - to join together for a day of inspiring talks, insights on how technology is powering change, and educational workshops. 
We can't wait to kick off our third year - two amazing days next March to immerse fully in a fun, supportive environment! The Festival starts with a pitch day for female-founded companies on Friday, March 24th; the following day is an all-day action-packed event, filled with panels, keynotes, workshop sessions, and tons of amazing networking.

See you there! 
#SVFWIT17   #SVFWomenTechFest
title: Women in Tech Festival 2017: Building the She-Conomy

The Cannaisseur Tour is one event that all Cannaisseurs (Cannabis Enthusiasts) will plan to attend. The Cannaisseur Tour will be a premier event destination for Cannabis Enthusiasts for advancing the concept of sustainable, Outdoor & Indoor farming, as well as educating the public about safe and responsible access and use of medical cannabis.

The Cannaisseur Tour will also reward those who take pride in the values of great cannabis with cash rewards given to those who have mastered the art of Cannabis growing/harvesting, extractions, edibles, wine pairing and more.



The Cannaisseur Tour objective is to bring together experts and educators in the field of cannabis, wine, concentrates, edibles, and glass-makers to educate the public about safe and responsible use and access of cannabis.

This will be the most luxurious, organic, outdoor & indoor medical cannabis competition in the world. As a group, The Cannaisseur tour prides itself in bringing together experts and educators in the cannabis fields to our event to help educate and teach the community about safe and responsible access and use of Medical Cannabis.

It is a community celebration that will grow to become a global movement honoring the Tours finest, organic, sun-grown, indoor grown, hydro grown medicinal cannabis harvest around.



The Cannaisseur Tour will transform into not only a competition of fun events such as "Bring Your Own Plant", "Growers Knowledge" , Wine & Weed (21+ only), etc.., but just as importantly, into an educational fun event for the most up to date in education with Medical Doctors (with onsite evaluations), Flowers, Extracts, Edibles, Vape products and much more in the cannabis culture.

description:
Bioluminescence is the production and emission of light by a living organism. On dark (moonless) nights on Tomales Bay, bluish white flickers are visible in the water column, which come from blooms of bioluminescent “dinoflagellates”. These tiny creatures emit short flashes of light when disturbed, and at certain times of the year put on quite a show for kayakers. Schools of fish in the bay create a phosphorescent trail which can look like a glowing cloud in the water. 

On July 30th Salty Sound and Blue water Kayaking are collaborating on a  bioluminecence Kayaking trips. Blue Water Kayaking are running the kayaking trips with there expereince and veteran staff. Its a 24 hour camping trip located on a kayak only group camp site.  This means to get there its a short paddle across the bay. It is not the most challenging paddle, and most people are fully capable of accomplishing it. I do however require that you are comfortable in the water. Its a great time, and a hidden gem. Come  eat, come drink, come play. The cost of this trip is around $200 but worth every cent. There are very limited spaces. Please invite others who you think would be interested in such an event. For more information check out www.saltysound.com.
title: Bioluminescence Kayaking-Salty Sound

REGINA SPEKTOR will perform at the Greek Theatre at UC Berkeley on Friday, April 7th!

Presale begins Thursday, November 3rd at 10am!
(password = remember) via Another Planet's official website, www.APEConcerts.com.

The general on sale begins Friday, November 4th at 10am.

Watch REGINA SPEKTOR:
https://www.youtube.com/reginaspektor

Listen to REGINA SPEKTOR:
https://soundcloud.com/reginaspektor

About REGINA SPEKTOR:
Born in the Soviet Union, Spektor began studying classical piano when she was six. Her family emigrated in 1989, landing in New York City, where she continued her classical training. Spektor eventually studied composition at the Conservatory of Music at Purchase College where she graduated with honors. She began writing pop songs in her late teens and made her recorded debut in 2001 with the self-released11:11, a collection of songs heavily influenced by jazz and blues. Songs followed in 2002 and Soviet Kitsch in 2004.

Spektor’s commercial breakthrough came in 2006 on her fourth LP, Begin to Hope. The gold-certified album included the singles “On the Radio,” “Better” and “Fidelity,” which climbed the Billboard Hot 100 singles chart. Spektor’s fifth album, Far released in 2009, and sixth album, What We Saw From the Cheap Seats released in 2012, both debuted at No. 3 on the Billboard 200 albums chart.
title: Regina Spektor at Greek Theatre at UC Berkeley

About BILL MAHER:
For more than twenty years, Bill Maher has set the boundaries of where funny, politicaltalk can go on American television.  First on “Politically Incorrect” (Comedy Central, ABC,1993-2002), and for the last fourteen years on HBO’s “Real Time,” Maher’s combination of unflinching honesty and big laughs have garnered him 38 Emmy nominations.  Maher won his first Emmy in 2014 as executive producer for the HBO series, “VICE.” In October of 2008, this same combination was on display in Maher’s uproarious and unprecedented swipe at organized religion, “Religulous,” directed by Larry Charles (“Borat”). Most importantly, The Untz has crewed up with some of the most forward-thinking bass fiends on the planet in Sub.mission, Wormhole SF Bay Area, ThazDope Records, and ShadowTrix Music to curate the best-of-the-best in what's next.

Overview:
It has been said that business is moving from the Age of Competition to 
the Age of Collaboration. Synergy is the next level of effectiveness 
beyond mere collaboration. Organizations composed of synergistic teams 
are resilient, powerful, creative, and effective. 
Organizations clearly need fresh creative ideas constantly to stay 
competitive, to create new markets, to gain and retain new clients, and 
to be respected in the capital markets. But at a time of massive global 
economic uncertainty, and a "bunker mentality" present in many 
organizations, the very creativity and intuition needed to bring new 
solutions and fresh ideas is often squelched by the drone of stress and 
desperation. 
Ground-breaking work done over the past 25 years at HeartMath, an 
innovative research and training center near Silicon Valley, has shaped 
new understandings of the roots of creativity and intuition and how to 
increase their presence in our lives. 
Bruce Cryer's 20-year association with the Stanford Business School and 
extensive work with clients on four clients, has led to the development 
of key principles for developing creativity and intuition.

Event link:  http://www.trainhr.com/control/w_product/~product_...

Featuring Heather Manus, RN: Lisa LeFevre RT(R) MBA: Julie Monterio RN, BSK.
