title: The Future of You - TEDGlobal Live Stream

description:
Learn to create your very own Burlesque routine under the tutelage of expert instructor Elsa Von Schmaltz!

Students will learn the fundamentals of Burlesque history and style, develop a character and persona, and create, costume, and choreograph their own routine in a fully supported atmosphere.

This class includes:

*Six group lessons

*Five private lessons

*1 8x10 printed photo of you and 1 photo of your class

*Digital access to photos and video from the show

*Public graduation recital (2 shows) at the West Hall Theater in the Oddfellows Building on Saturday April 20th!

*Workshop Wrap Up Potluck where you will watch the video of your performance and decompress with your fellow students.

This series is a performance workshop, not a dance class. We encourage you to attend our weekly Thursday Bump & Grind class if you wish to expand your movement skills! To check out our full class offering and schedule, visit our calendar at www.academyofburlesque.com.

Weekly group classes: 

6 Saturdays 1:00 - 3:00pm*, starting on Saturday March 18, 2017

  *The First class of the session will run from 1:00 - 3:00pm.

Private lessons will start the second week, on Saturdays after group class and Monday evenings after 5pm.

LOCATION: La Vida Dance Studio at 13620 NE 20th St, Bellevue, WA 98005

Final Recital on Saturday, April 29th in the West Hall of the Oddfellows Building at 912 E Pine St, Seattle, WA

TUITION:

$729 before February 16

$789 after February 16

$300 deposit reserves your spot and locks in your tuition price based on registration date

Payment Plan:

$300 deposit, 2 additional installments of $250 each. Available until February 4th.

Refunds/Cancellations/Transfers Policy

Deposits are non-refundable, and non-transferrable to another student.

Fees paid for one class are not transferrable to another class.

If class is cancelled by AOB, pre-payments will be refunded to students within 4 weeks, or the student may choose to receive class credit instead, which will be held for up to 1 year.

If student cancels BEFORE CLASS STARTS – deposit is non-refundable, but any other class fee will be refunded.

If student drops out within two days after first class of a session, 50% of total class fee may be refunded to student.

If student drops out three or more days after first class of a session, their spot is not fillable, and thus their class fee is non-refundable.

If student decides within two days after the first class of a session to transfer to another session, the transfer will be permitted under the following conditions: an additional deposit to hold their spot in the next session will be required. All paid fees will be applicable towards the next session. Start date of new session must be within 6 months of start date of previous session. If session price increases, student is responsible for paying the difference. If that session is on waitlist, student will be added to end of waitlist. If student’s name does not come up within 6 months, paid fees are non-refundable.

If student decides three or more days after the first class of a session to transfer to another session, the transfer will be permitted at the discretion of the administrators and will be subject to the following conditions: an additional deposit to hold their spot in the next session will be required. 50% of previously paid fees will be applicable towards the next session. Start date of new session must be within 6 months of start date of previous session. If session price increases, student is responsible for paying the difference. If that session is on waitlist, student will be added to end of waitlist. If student’s name does not come up within 6 months, paid fees are non-refundable.
title: Eastside Burlesque 101 - Spring 2017

description:
Join us Wednesday, March 15 at CenturyLink Events Center 3 p.m. - 9 p.m. for this Seattle tech tradition!

We'll be bringing back the ping-pong paddles, dodgeball courts, and foosball tables at Seattle's biggest, geekiest tech party. Now in its 6th year, the GeekWire Bash has it all: beer pong, video games, arcades, sumo wrestling, cornhole, and MORE. The bigger the better to accommodate all the geeky madness.



Not interested in games? No worries. This is a party first and foremost. The GeekWire Bash is a unique setting to mix and mingle with hundreds of key members of the Seattle tech community.

Find your next great tech job, employee, customer, business connection, startup partner — heck maybe even your future husband or wife. We'll have great prizes, special guests, good friends, good times, and lots of food and drink.

Buy your tickets below today. Remember, all ping pong, foosball, and dodgeball tournament players must be checked in by 3:30 p.m. Each organization is limited to 2 ping pong competitors per tournament, 2 foosball teams, and 1 dodgeball team. All tournament tickets include admission to the entire event.

Registration deadline is March 1 for the tournaments. Due to tournament logistics, players are not able to participate in multiple tournaments. Questions about tournaments? Contact Cara Kuhlman (cara@geekwire.com).

Important note: GeekWire Startup, Gold, Super and Galactic Pass Members are automatically signed up for this event — no need to register separately. Members receive email reminders in advance of each event. For more information and to purchase an annual pass, see our membership page.

Please note this event is 21+. 

Registration deadline is March 1 for the tournaments. Early-bird rates end February 10. Also, see our terms of use and code of conduct for GeekWire events. Geekwire Bash branding designed by Chris Lewman.

Qumulo | Moz | CenturyLink 

Sirqul | Flowroute | ReachNow

title: GeekWire Bash

description: What is Burlesque Dance all about? Learn to make “Burlesque Breakfast” while you perfect your bump and refine your grind in this all-levels dance class with Academy of Burlesque Staff. Through set warm-ups and varied “across-the-floor” exercises to fun music, this class uses classic Burlesque moves and techniques to tone muscles and build basic dance skills.  New choreographic phrases are introduced each week, and moves are connected to build longer combinations. This class is offered in 6 or 8 week series packages, but may also be taken as a drop-in class.  Perfect for new dancers and those coming back to dance after a long break.Wear fitted workout/dance wear and bring low-medium heels with an ankle strap.
title: Bump&Grind Dance Class

description: We’ve adapted our Bump&Grind dance class to offer it at Westlake Dance Center in Shoreline. This fun and challenging hour-long class will give you a good warmup and sassy choreography. This class is ongoing, no series.
title: Intermediate Bump&Grind

description: "NO FLEX ZONE" is Northwest's Premier Hip Hop Dance Showcase. "NO FLEX ZONE 3" will be held March 25, 2017. We will bring together hip hop dance crews from across the Pacific Northwest! The showcase brings together hip hop dancers to share their passion and talents in a judge free and positive venue! Again, we will gathered some of the best groups from across the Northwest to showcase their talents and creativity.
title: No Flex Zone 3 - Northwest Hip Hop Dance Showcase

description: Ever learned how to walk in teetering stilettos? Want that shapely behind as you sashay in tall high-heeled shoes? Can you chase down a taxi in your faux Prada pumps? This class will teach you the elusive skill of strutting with confidence, sex appeal, and style. At the conclusion of this class students will be able to choose a shoe style that works for them, understand the impact of high heels on body mechanics, and have an arsenal of strategies to handle walking in heels.  Students should bring two pairs of heels of varying heights (one “high-ish”, one “lower-ish”) in their size to practice in.  Walking up and down stairs may be practiced, weather permitting.
title: Walking in Heels

description: Women in the Golden Age of Burlesque refined teasing to an art – the art of strip-tease! Vintage vixens from 1930-1960 had very special “Classic” moves and individual styles. In this introductory class, students are empowered to explore and discover their own inner tease-artiste in a safe and friendly environment while learning about the Legends of the past. Using the hands-on examples of Classic Burlesque techniques and archetypal props like gloves and boas, students will discover a Legend or archetype they can relate to! No dancing or dance skill required. Recommended for those new to Burlesque.
title: Art of the Tease

description:
737 Productions proudly presents the return of the legendary one and only The Generators

 from Los Angeles. Long running streetpunks the Generators have toured

all over the world. Last year saw them release a greatest hits

compilation on Randaleshop/Randale-Records

 entitled "Earn Your Stripes". This was followed with a  couple western

Canadian tour dates and TWO European tours, plus of course multiple

jaunts around the USA. The album features several brand new songs, and

their most popular tunes from the last 20 years.   http://www.the-generators.com/ https://not-yer-buddy-records.bandcamp.com/track/the-generators-so-sick-of-this  Also coming to town for this bill will be Ucluelet's STRT SWPR. These skater/surfer dudes from out in the mist put the skateboarding back in skate rock.  https://streetsweeperskaterock.bandcamp.com/  Opening up this round of punk rock n' roll goodness will be local high energy favourites The MAGS! Always a fun time these guys are!   https://soundcloud.com/themags  Advance tickets $14 available online and at CAVITY Curiosity Shop soon.   737 Productions
title: The Generators, Street Sweeper, and The Mags

description:
The Hot Chocolate 15k/5k returns to Seattle, are you ready?

Sunday, March 5th, 2017
Seattle Center, Seattle, Washington

5k: 6:45am
15k: 7:45am

*start times subject to change.

It's the event for the whole family! A brisk 15k or 5k run, with inflatables and games to occupy the kids and an ALL-CHOCOLATE post-race party that will blow your mind. Join thousands of your fellow runners & enjoy some of the sweetest miles you'll ever run!

There will be TONS of chocolate! Tons? TONS.

Too cold? It will all be worth it when you cross the finish line greeted by delicious hot chocolate, chocolate goodies, and chocolate fondue (equipped with marshmallows, bananas, rice krispies and pretzels). Who wouldn't want to run for chocolate? :-P

Did we mention the awesome goodie bag? All participants will receive a sweet full zip jacket (his/hers styles!). In addition, all 15K finishers will receive an official Hot Chocolate Seattle medal to commemorate their awesome achievement.

Running not your thing? We're always looking for people eager to volunteer!

Ronald McDonald House Charities (RMHC), the official charity of the 2017 Hot Chocolate Seattle 15k/5k, is a welcoming “home-away-from-home” for families with children facing medical challenges, providing an atmosphere of comfort, hope and courage.  For more information, visit their website:  https://www.rmhc.org.

Register now at  http://bit.ly/2bCnv0h 

Happy running!
title: Hot Chocolate 15k/5k Seattle

description:
Grammy Award winning and multi-platinum selling music artist The Weeknd unveiled details behind his first-ever world tour – Starboy: Legend of the Fall 2017 World Tour. 

The Weeknd’s fourth full-length album, Starboy, is set for release November 25, 2016. The title track, featuring Daft Punk, broke the record for “Most Release Weekend Streams Ever” upon its release. In less than a week, the single amassed over 17 million streams globally and 6.5 million streams in the United States, becoming the #1 Most Added at Top 40, Rhythm, Urban, and Hot AC.

General Public on sale starts on Friday, November 4 at 10am. 

MOViN 92.5 has the inside on Presale tickets to The Weeknd!
Presale is Thursday, November 3 between 10:00am and 10:00pm (or until tickets sell out).
Presale password: MOVIN

Visit www.movin925.com for all of the details!

title: Deadmau5

description:
Introducing the world’s FIRST obstacle course race inspired by the world of magic and wizardry!

Join all of your mud-covered magical friends as they navigate their way over obstacles that only a witch or wizard worth their wand would know how to overcome…fire-burning cauldrons, the slythering wall, the witch's pit…all while being chased by hordes of Lost Souls(zombies have nothing on us)! The 5k (3.1 mile) course is comprised of 12 wizarding obstacles to defeat, some of which may require a helping wand from a fellow witch or wizard. This is it. THIS is what you’ve been waiting for. Register today to secure your spot in what we anticipate will be a sold-out event!

THIS IS AN IMMERSIVE EXPERIENCE.

The Muddy Mortal is SO much more than just a 5k obstacle course race. Our magical gates open on the afternoon of Friday, June 16, 2017 to kick off the weekend festivities with live entertainment by Wizard Wrock bands and exciting Wizard Games in the festival village. Saturday is a FULL day of enchanting experiences beginning with the Muddy Mortal obstacle course race inspired by the world of magic & wizardry. Spectators/festival goers can cheer on their favorite mortal from the sideline or spend the day browsing the shops on Merlin's Alley, participating in the numerous events and activities in Crone's Corner festival square, or watching their favorite teams compete on the quidditch pitch. The choice is yours. On Saturday evening, you’ll want to come dressed to impress in your wizard best and join us for our Wizard Wrockfest and enjoy a mug of Witch's Brew. For those of you holding a ticket to the Fantastic Feast, you’ll join us under a canopy of stars for this very special seat-limited “farm to fork” feast filled with fresh locally, sourced flavorful fare.

As if things couldn’t possibly get any better, all Muddy Mortal participants also receive an event t-shirt, a finisher’s medal, free festival entry, and a mug of "Witch's Brew" (21 and older)!

Not just another obstacle course race! The Muddy Mortal is an immersive experience that puts YOU right in the heart of the action in our very own Merlin's Alley!! Held over the course of one magical weekend, our festival gates open on the afternoon of Friday, June 16, 2017 to kick off the weekend festivities with live entertainment by Wizard Wrock bands and exciting Wizard Games in the festival square along the streets of Crone's Corner. Saturday, June 17, 2017 offers a FULL day of enchanting experiences beginning with the Muddy Mortal obstacle course race inspired by the world of magic and wizardry. Spectators/festival goers can cheer on their favorite mortal from the sideline or spend the day browsing the shops (vendors) on Merlin's Alley, participating in the numerous events and activities in Crone's Corner festival square, or watching their favorite teams compete on the quidditch pitch. The choice is yours. On Saturday evening, you’ll want to come dressed to impress in your wizard best and join us for our Wizard Wrockfest where you can enjoy a refreshing mug of Witch's Brew! For those of you holding a pass that includes the Fantastic Feast, you’ll join us under a canopy of stars a seat-limited “farm to fork” feast filled with fresh locally, sourced flavorful faire.

Merlin's Alley

Browse the “shops” along the bustling Merlin's Alley where you’ll find everything that a witch or wizard could ask for. Catch a live demonstration by one of our numerous master craftsmen/women including candle and soap making, glass blowing, blacksmithing, and wand making! In need of a new wand? Don’t forget to stop by our wand shop where the “wand chooses the wizard.” Need to hone a few of your magical skills? Participate in potions class, divination, dark arts defense, and wizard dueling based on our "Science of Magic" programming!

Festival Activities

Come join the fun and participate in all that our festival has to offer! Here’s a partial list of what you’ll find in our festival square!

Hay Maze
Pumpkin (or melon) Chunkin Contest
Wizard Chess
Broom Races
Mechanical Broom Challenge
Costume Contest
Autumnal Soccer
Kids’ Inflatable Obstacle Course
Witchway Hunt
Campfire Stories in Quidditch Pitch Campground
Trick-or-Treating for our young witches and wizards
Wide World of Wizard Sports

Calling all wizard sport athletes and fans!! Join us for demonstrations, matches, and a wizard sports gear expo...we have it all!
title: Muddy Mortal Seattle

About Ivan Smagghe:Along with the likes of occasional partner-in-crime Andrew Weatherall, Ivan has the ability to play music like a raw conduit between his famously obscure records and the dancefloor's strobe-soaked bodies, injecting something of himself seamlessly into the mix along the way.

France's most wanted radio host and selector, Ivan Smagghe stands at the crossroads between glamorous parisian hype and musical integrity.

His genre defying/defining production work originally in Black Strobe and now in It’s A Fine Line (who have recently finished Battant's second LP, As I Ride with No Horse) has connected him to and garnered the praise of (amongst others) James Murphy, Trevor Jackson, Ata, Optimo and the aforementioned Weatherall. All fellow crusaders in the fight to prove that electronic music can be so much more than a one dimensional soundtrack for a night on the lash.

The success of his musical blog 'a few things from Ivan Smagghe' has generated a compilation series of edits for Paris uber-fashion store Colette. The first volume sold out in a couple of weeks. His project with Tim Paris, It's A Fine Line, has already put out numerous remixes (from Superpitcher to the XX) and releases that can't be pigeonholed (electro rockabilly on Kompakt to italo rickety disco on Marketing Music). Their new studio is now fully set for original music, remixes and production.

Aside from his A&R role for now 12 years old label Kill The DJ (who have released the first EP of RMVN, Ivan’s project with Roman Flugel), Ivan has also started solo work (a noted remix for Parisian label Meant) as well as more planned collaborations with musical friends (Ewan Pearson and Tiga being first on the list).

You can catch Ivan subverting the masses on any given weekend, all around the world. Go to http://afewthingsfromivansmagghe.blogspot.com/ for more info, thoughts, and edits.--------------------------------

Saturday March 25th10p-4a, 21+1809 Minor Ave #10
title: Ivan Smagghe + Secret Guest at Kremwerk / Timbre Room, March 25th

Native Plants of the PNW Coastal Lowlands
Saturday May 27th, 1pm-3:30pm

Location: Grays Harbor Community College (room)

Bill
 Brookreson, chair of the South Sound Chapter of the Washington Native 
Plants Society will begin the day with a talk at the Grays Harbor 
Community College where we will learn the ins and outs of our unique 
coastal ecosystems. Then we will head out into one of CRBLT's most 
beautiful properties to shine a new light on the flora of our PNW 
coastal lowlands. Prepare for a short drive (carpooling is encouraged!) 
from the Grays Harbor College to our 175-acre surge plains to enjoy a 
beautiful nature walk.

For more information contact Kylea at programservicesCRBLT@gmail.com or (360) 807-0764

description:
Invasive Species Strategies
Saturday, June 17th, 1pm-3:30pm

Location: Central Grays Harbor (Location TBD/Season Dependent)

We've
 all seen would-be beautiful spaces choked by a field of invasive 
plants, whether they be Scotch Broom, blackberry thickets, tansy, 
thistles, reed canary grass, knotweed.... you get the picture. But what 
is our local government doing about it, and how can we help? Join Nancy 
Ness, coordinator for the Grays Harbor County Noxious Weed Board on an 
exploratory workshop on invasive control methods in use by our local 
governments.

Nancy Ness
Nancy Ness has been coordinating the Grays Harbor County Noxious Weed 
Control Board for 19 years. Prior to that, she was WSU Master Gardener 
Coordinator in Mason County.
	

Walk & Workshop

Our weed walk will look at several weeds impacting the Chehalis Basin. 
Wear layers and shoes appropriate for weather and mud. Cameras and 
binoculars a plus!
	

For more information contact Kylea at programservicesCRBLT@gmail.com or (360) 807-0764
title: Learnings from the Chehalis | June

Music takes us to places we’ve never been - yet these places feel like home. Humankind’s collective and boundless love for music is a sublime reminder that there’s something else besides us in this universe - a harmonic connection between all living beings, everywhere. An indescribable energy, a universal connection that we ceaselessly crave.

Last year, we awakened this harmony and connected our minds and our senses as we captured and sustained our Bliss. We reveled in self revival and experienced love and light as we danced the night away. 

One revolution around the sun later, we prepare to gather once more to evolve our sonic exploration to new elevations - to continue to grow together through a world of musical metamorphosis. We prepare to transcend the every day worries and limitations of the modern world and travel together to a place where time and space stands still, a place in which all that matters is the Bliss and universal connectivity that music fosters.

Saturday, July 8th, 6:00pm-8:30pm

description:
Capstone Talk | State of the Basin: A Report Card for the Chehalis River
Tentative Date: Thursday, September 21st, 6:30pm-8:30pm

Location: TBD

This session will be the capstone event for “Learnings from the 
Chehalis.” Over the past 15 years, community volunteers, citizens, and 
government agencies have been putting effort in to making the Chehalis 
River clean and healthy for people, fish and wildlife.  How well have we
 done? This session will look at progress made on water quality 
improvement, salmon habitat restoration, water conservation, and the 
impacts of regulations and policies.

Our capstone talk will be held by a panel from the Chehalis Basin 
Partnership. The Chehalis Basin Partnership was formed in 1998 to 
provide a framework for local citizens, interest groups, and government 
organizations to work collaboratively to identify and solve 
water-related issues. Come with questions!
title: Learnings from the Chehalis | September

description:
For the last 25 years, NARAL Pro-Choice Washington's annual Chocolate for Choice event has helped raise funds to protect women's rights through legislation, education and grassroots organizing. Chocolate for Choice is a fantastic opportunity to eat delicious treats, sip on wine and choice cocktails, and mingle with the progressive Seattle community while supporting reproductive freedom in Washington State. 

Ticket prices begin at $50. You can purchase tickets online here:
https://act1.myngp.com/Forms/-3810608234708860928

We have our work cut out for us in the coming year, and we are ready to tackle the challenges head on. We expect a nationwide effort to roll back reproductive rights, and we are already seeing emboldened anti-choice politicians in Washington State. With your help, we can work to pass progressive, pro-choice, pro-woman legislation this year, support our champions in the legislature and hold anti-choice politicians accountable!

We hope you will join us for an unforgettable evening!

BIG thank you to our event sponsors:  Senator Patty Murray, Guild Seattle, Valerie Tarico and Brian Arbogast, the Quackenbush Family, Elaine Nonneman, Gillaspy & Rhode, PLLC, Leigh Pate, Washington Women for Choice, Congressman Adam Smith, Seattle First Asset Management, In memory of Bob Phelps, Team Diva Real Estate, Patricia Schroeder and Davina Camardo. 

Want to make an even bigger impact? You can sign up to sponsor the event for as little as $350. We offer a variety or perks to all our sponsors, including take home chocolate and guest entries. 
Interested? More information is available here:
https://act1.myngp.com/Forms/-4459408056026923008

description:
Forestland Resiliency - Meeting Future Changes

August 5th, Saturday 1pm-3:30pm

We will tour a small, locally owned forest and learn about the biggest issues for local forests: threat of conversion, climate change, and biodiversity loss--with a focus on what landowners should know and actions they can be taking today to address these issues.

Speakers will include a team of forestry professionals including: Andrea Watts, a local forest 
landowner, science writer, and editor on numerous forestry related 
issues, and experts with the WA Department of Natural Resources, 
including Forest Pathologist Amy Ramsey, Forest Geneticist Jeff DeBell ,
 Small Forest Landowner Technical Assistance Forester Josh Meek and 
Forest Stewardship Program Forester Julie Sackett.

description:
Tim & the Glory Boys are headed your way on their 2017 HOOTENANNY tour!

Tim Neufeld (also of the band “STARFIELD”) is a multiple JUNO, Dove, and Covenant award winning Christian artist based out of Abbotsford, British Columbia. He and the Glory Boys (A world-class Canadian bluegrass trio) have shared the stage on cross-Canada tours with artists such as Third Day, and most recently, his worshipfulness, Chris Tomlin. Now, starting September 2016, they’re hitting the road on their biggest headlining tour to date, bringing their ‘Worship Hoedown’ to your backyard!

What is “Worship Hoedown” you ask?

It’s a bluegrass inspired night of music and joy... beards, banjos, and blessings for the whole family! A night of corporate worship; with hymns, choruses, original songs, and comedy, geared towards all ages and denominations. It’s Baptists, Pentecostals, Catholics (and everything in between). It’s the local churches coming together to worship in unity, It’s a HOOTENANNY!
title: The HOOTENANNY! Tour | 100 Mile House, BC

description:
Local Queen proudly presents:

The LEGENDARY Miss Coco Peru's return to Portland in

THE TAMING OF THE TENSION!

Coco has been very tense lately and her doctor won’t prescribe pills! What’s a drag queen to do?

Put on a show!

Join Coco for an evening of storytelling, songs and venting as Coco seeks to TAME THE TENSION!

And for the first time ever Coco will be taking questions from her audience! So, think of good ones to ask!!! 

And kids, she ain’t getting any younger…SEE HER NOW!

MAY THE TAMER BE WITH YOU!

 + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + +

PARIS THEATRE (6 SW THIRD, PORTLAND)

Doors at 7PM SHARP! Advanced ticket holders will be allowed in first.

This event is 21+ only. Limited tables and seating available plus standing room in back.

Tickets $20 in advanced, $25 at the door - but hurry and get yours if you want a good seat!
title: Miss Coco Peru: The Taming Of The Tension

description:
Experience a Personal Evolution in this weekend immersive Tantra eventTantra
 Meditations Weekend Retreat
	 ~ 2-day complete immersion retreat 
(previously known as Tantra Meditations: 5 week series) is located in 
the healing gardens of
	 Sacred Garden of Tantra's Meditation & 
Healing Center. 
	Through these five sessions over two days, you 
will experience and practice key techniques and ancient meditation 
practices of traditional Tantra. This foundation course of Traditional 
Tantra focuses on
	 relaxing the body and strengthening the 
mind 
	in preparation for level one tantra practices. This weekend
 Tantra retreat is designed for complete immersion. The world is so 
intense right now - 
	we find sacred grounding in nature, each other, and 
the many forms of yoga.
	We will practice different #Tantra specific 
body work with Tantric #meditations as well as partner practices in the company
 of like minded friends. Within each of the five sessions, 
	Rashmi will 
guide you through a mind strengthening meditation and will reveal to you
 the the associated sadhana based upon the session's practices.
	 These 
ancient 
meditations 
	promote healing between the masculine and feminine in 
each individual, which is so vital to our happiness and healing of 
ourselves first and then the world.
	 No partner is necessary. This series is applicable to individuals and couples alike. 
	Come and learn to connect more deeply with #Kundalini #Shakti, the 
primordial sexual energy within. In this series you will learn to 
harness Shakti's dynamic vibration to fuel the meditative process in order to
 access deeper states of awareness.  
	Sexual energy is 
completely natural. You can use it to revitalize yourself again! 
	When we
 learn how to let our sexual energy flow, as it is meant to in nature.  
	It revitalizes us and makes us radiant and magnetic.  Learn how to feel energized & connected through relationships instead of being overwhelmed by them.
Personal time will be given for self practice and to experiment & contemplate at the end of the first day.
 Suitable for all levels. Wherever you are on your journey, your experiences will deepen.Registration Fee: 

With Saturday overnight accommodation in group room (bring your own 
sleeping bag & pillow), Saturday & Sunday lunches, Saturday 
dinner & Sunday Breakfast
	

Til February 9th, $239/individual

After February 9th, $289/individual

Til February 9th, $200/individual, without overnight accommodation

After February 9th, $250/individual, without overnight accommodation

Additional lodging accommodation options:In addition to above accommodation option, Private room with bed ~ $79 individual (including Saturday dinner & Sunday Breakfast) available. Suitable for couples,  limited supply.

~Participation is limited. All spots are reserved on a first come first serve basis.

 All major credit cards, checks and cash are accepted. Schedule: (choice between these two weekends)Saturday, March 4th 2017, 10.00am  -  Sunday, March 5th, 2017, 3.30pm or

Saturday, March 25th 2017, 10.00am  -  Sunday, March 26th, 2017, 3.30pm

Location: Sacred Garden Tantra Meditation & Healing Center33829 Smith Road, St. Helens, Oregon 97051Note:  All participants remain fully clothed and there is absolutely No sexual contact.

Work Exchange Opportunity: Two
 (2) spots are available for work exchange opportunity for a discounted 
registration fee for those who are in genuine need or in financial distress.
	

Contact us directly at sacredgardenoftantra@gmail.com to request work exchange opportunity.

description:
Amidst the fundamental skills to learn in childhood is proper etiquette, however there are few settings where most children are exposed to learning best practices. Sign up your 1st-6th grade children for a memorable, worthwhile, and yes...fun Etiquette Tea. You'll check in your child at the door of Deepwood's Museum Home at 11am and pick him/her up at 1pm having enjoyed a children's tea menu with lessons accompanying each course and ending with a tour of the Victorian home. Scheduled during Spring Break, the tea offers a fun trip for participants to explore Victorian days with vintage tea cups, silverware and a regal setting.  Our tea hostess will present with the charm and grace of days gone by. Your child will use the lessons learned for years to come. 



Catered by Gardner House Cafe. Set menus no substitutions available. Gluten-free option available for an additional $6 fee per ticket. Tickets are non-refundable but are transferable to another name.
title: Children's Etiquette Tea

description:
Location: OSU-Cascades, Tykeson Hall, Room 206, 2nd Floor, 1500 southwest chandler ave 97702

Join us March 23rd for the next TEDxBendSalon in our monthly Salon series as we focus on the topic of Learners and Teachers: Education. TEDxBend hosts Salon events in between our bigger events to build community, which is both the engine and cornerstone of TEDx. Many thanks to our Community Partner,  OSU-Cascades, for generously providing their Learning Studio for this salon.

All TEDxBendSalon events share the same characteristics: brevity, opportunities for conversation and heightened interaction between the speaker and audience. And unlike larger annual TEDx events, our salons focus on an issue, even a question that’s of interest. Short and sweet, each event lasts a couple of hours rather than being an all-day affair. Though the salon’s flexible nature allows it to take varied forms, salon attendees always watch a selection of TED Talks, and occasionally a few live speakers, followed by discussions about the ideas. In 2017, we plan to host Salon events that are timely, hinging on a specific topics in the news.



	Free
title: TEDxBendSalon — Learners and Teachers: Education

description:
Kicking off our 2017 Learning on the Land series, the Blue Mountain Land Trust is proud to sponsor the third annual Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This festival is a collection of films from the South Yuba River Citizens League in Nevada City, California. Wild & Scenic presents films that speak to the environmental concerns and celebrates the natural beauty of our planet. This international tour visits over 200 communities around the globe - and on April 14 it arrives in Walla Walla!
This event is made possible through generous support from Banner Bank and Columbia REA.
title: WIld & Scenic Film Festival

description:
The Poetry Brothel is a unique and immersive poetry event that takes poetry outside classrooms and lecture halls and places it in the lush interiors of a bordello. The Poetry Brothel presents a rotating cast of both male and female poets as “whores,” each operating within a carefully crafted character, who impart their work in public readings, spontaneous eruptions of poetry, and most distinctly, as purveyors of private poetry readings on beds, chaise lounges and in private rooms. For a small fee, all of the “poetry whores” are available for these sequestered readings at any time during the event. Of course, any true brothel needs a good cover; The Poetry Brothel’s is an immersive cabaret, offering a full bar, musicians, burlesque dancers, painters, actors, and fortune-tellers, with newly integrated themes, performances and installations at each event.

Doors open at 6pm; show starts at 6:30pm. Themed costumes and/or evening wear are encouraged but not required. This event is 21+.

For specific event details, please visit www.thepoetrybrothel.com/events.html.
title: The Poetry Brothel: Portland

description:
The Inland Northwest's premier continuing education event for fitness professionals


	Our goal is to empower you through education by bringing in some of the fitness industry's top educators and fitness professionals, meeting new people and providing a fun environment in which to network.
	

**Earn up to 1.2 CEU's from NSCA, NASM, AFAA and ACE**

Pre-Conference Event (0.4 CEU's)
Friday, March 24thEvaluating and Applying Research in the Fitness Industry + VIP dinner Max of 20 attendees

12:30 PM – 1:00 PM   |   Registration

1:00 PM – 3:00 PM   |   Part 1: Evaluating Research in the Fitness Industry by James Krieger, MS

This presentation instructs students how to evaluate research in the fitness industry.

3:00 PM – 5:00 PM   |   Part 2: Applying Evidence Based Practice in the Fitness Industry by Brad Dieter, PhD

This presentation instructs students how to utilize the skills and tools of evaluating research and applying it to practice.

5:00 PM – 8:00 PM   |   VIP Dinner

_______________________________________________________________________________

Inland Empire Fitness Conference (0.8 CEU's)

Saturday, March 25th

7:15 AM – 7:45 AM   |  Registration

7:45 AM – 8:00 AM  |  Introduction

8:00 AM – 8:50 AM   |  The Effects of High-Intensity Interval Training on People with Type 2 Diabetes by April Davis, MS, ACSM-CEP, RDN

This presentation will demonstrate the current evidence to support the use of HIIT in clinical practice, and how to work with an exercise physiologist to implement or prescribe this type of training for patients who have type II diabetes.

9:00 AM – 9:50 AM   |  3 Principles to Make Strength Training More Joint Friendly by Tim Arndt, MS

This lecture will teach you the basic concepts of how to make any strength training exercise more joint friendly utilizing biomechanics to reduce joint forces.

10:00 AM – 10:50 AM   |  Bodyweight Regulation – What Really Controls the Scale by Brad Dieter, PhD

This presentation will discuss the mechanisms of body weight regulation and dissect current models and instantiate a new way of viewing body weight regulation.

11:00 AM – 11:50 AM   |  Metabolism Myth – Impact of NEAT on Body Composition by James Krieger, MS

The presentation takes the audience through the various components of energy expenditure, their roles in weight regulation, and why NEAT has by far the strongest impact.

12:00 PM – 1:00 PM   |  Catered Lunch

1:00 PM – 1:50 PM   |  Challenging the HIT Trend – Is a dose of Low-Intensity exercise Training an Ideal Physiological Prescription? by Vanessa Martinez, PhD

This lecture teaches trainers to recognize the need to find a compromise between the ideal physiological prescription and a manageable behavior prescription in order to allow adherence to be sufficient for health improvements.

2:00 PM – 2:50 PM   |  Defining Functional Training & What Makes an Exercise Functional by Tim Arndt, MS

Should we train motions or muscles? This lecture will attempt to answer that by taking a critical look at the definition of functional training and what makes an exercise functional.

3:00 PM – 3:50 PM   |  Fructose Metabolism: What the Science Really Tells Us by Brad Dieter, PhD

This presentation will discuss the role of fructose in human metabolism and how it relates to health and disease.

4:00 PM – 4:50 PM   |  The Science of Sugar – Impact of Sugar on Body Composition by James Krieger, MS

This presentation looks at the impacts of sugar intake on body composition, the history of why sugar is often blamed for obesity and addresses the potential mechanisms as to how sugar might contribute to obesity, then looks to see if there is any scientific data to support these mechanisms.

4:50 PM – 5:10 PM   |  Raffle prizes

6:00 PM – 9:00 PM   |  Dinner & Networking at Luigi’s (not required; separate charge of ~$35/person. Cash only)

*All topics are lecture and discussion based
title: The Inland Empire Fitness Conference

description:
Tim & the Glory Boys are headed your way on their 2017 HOOTENANNY tour!

Tim Neufeld (also of the band “STARFIELD”) is a multiple JUNO, Dove, and Covenant award winning Christian artist based out of Abbotsford, British Columbia. He and the Glory Boys (A world-class Canadian bluegrass trio) have shared the stage on cross-Canada tours with artists such as Third Day, and most recently, his worshipfulness, Chris Tomlin. Now, starting September 2016, they’re hitting the road on their biggest headlining tour to date, bringing their ‘Worship Hoedown’ to your backyard!

What is “Worship Hoedown” you ask?

It’s a bluegrass inspired night of music and joy... beards, banjos, and blessings for the whole family! A night of corporate worship; with hymns, choruses, original songs, and comedy, geared towards all ages and denominations. It’s Baptists, Pentecostals, Catholics (and everything in between). It’s the local churches coming together to worship in unity, It’s a HOOTENANNY!
title: The HOOTENANNY! Tour | Salmon Arm, BC

description:
When it comes to throwing a party, the Pimps of Joytime raise the bar with swagger to spare. Rhythms and textures drawn from New Orleans funk, 90s club house, 60s salsa and hip­hop all collide and fracture upon one another on their new LP, Jukestone Paradise. Dubbed "raucous and captivating" by Okayplayer, their album cuts play like the soundtrack for a ride through Brooklyn’s diverse neighborhoods, where the group's sound materialized. And the Pimps' live experience only takes it higher. Over the past decade, the group's grassroots following mobilized from the underground club scene in New York to sell out historic venues like the Fillmore in San Francisco and showcase at festivals across the US and Europe. With more than 1 million Spotify plays to date, it seems word truly does spread to the wise. And when you pair high­caliber musicianship with rhythm and groove as universally enticing as it is unconventional, there's no denying the dancefloor.


Led by the soulful vocals of Sarah Clarke, Dirty Revival has made their mark on the Pacific Northwest music scene. The unique ensemble delivers powerful original tracks and superbly arranged classics with a resounding presence, delivering passionate performances from dimly lit dive bars to crowded concert halls and open festival skies. 

The dynamic, seven-piece soul outfit shines on stage, and defines influences from funk- and soul-infused icons of the past. Dirty Revival has shared the stages with musical heavy-hitters such as Michael Franti, George Clinton and the Parliament Funkadelic, Sir Mix-A-Lot, Slick Rick, Nappy Roots and Gift of Gab, and have several multi-regional tours already under their belt.
title: Pimps Of Joytime w/ Dirty Revival at Volcanic

description:
Beloved Festival & Soul'd Out Productions Present:

Dirtwire
w/ Plantrae & Lapa
Thursday, March 9, 2017
Star Theater Portland
8pm Door/9pm Show  |  21+

Tickets on sale now! ($15 Adv.)

~ Dirtwire ~

Dirtwire is David Satori of Beats Antique, Evan Fraser of Stellamara and Mark Reveley of Jed and Lucia.

Dirtwire sits on the back porch of Americana’s future, conjuring up a whirlwind of sound using traditional instrumentation, world-beat percussion, and electronic soundscapes. Comprised of David Satori (Beats Antique), Evan Fraser (Hamsa Lila; Stellamara), and Mark Reveley (Jed and Lucia) each performance brings both band and audience to a mysterious crossroads of beats, blues, bluegrass, African, Asian, and South + Central American sounds. The result is a rebirth of Americana and a post-millennial psychedelic journey to downhome goodness. See more: https://www.dirtwire.net

~ Plantrae ~

Plantrae roams the forests and detritus of modernity, crafting earthy beat music clearly evocative of its NW origin. Energetic and serenely beautiful, Plantrae’s sound threads a distinctive path between acoustic instrumentation, and exhilarating electronic production. Live viola at every show brings an undercurrent of indelible warmth to an already lush palette. See more: https://plantrae.bandcamp.com

~ Lapa ~

As a producer under the moniker Lapa, Ilya Goldberg weaves together musical stories with complexly textured harmonies, expansive melodies, and intricately layered beats. His music blurs borders and transcends boundaries, illuminating the resonance of universal forces and teleporting people to wild, dream-like places of serenity and connection. See more: http://lapamusic.com
title: Dirtwire w/ Plantrae & Lapa • Star Theater

description:
Get tix here: bit.ly/MOwond2016
Tickets on sale Friday, 5/20 at 10AM

All ages show

Hotly tipped Danish songstress MØ aka. Karen Marie Ørsted is stirring up a buzz throughout the global blogosphere these days. Tastemaker media such as Pitchfork, The Guardian and NME wrote about her and she just returned home from CMJ in New York after playing some widely praised shows.

With no albums out and only 2 online tracks the 23-year- old MØ recently faced a bidding war, which ultimately led to signing with Sony for the Scandinavian territory. Now MØ is being pursued by some of the most respectable labels in the UK and US. Scandinavia, it seems, has done it again!

MØ is spending the fall in the studio, wrapping up her highly anticipated debut album with Ronni Vindahl of Danish producer entity No Wav.

Listeners can expect a lush, warm and soulful production, however MØ brings the Scandinavian cold/cool and a street vibe edge to the songs, which makes for a sonic juxtaposition.

Her unique mix of indie, pop, hip-hop, electro and soul is hella fresh sounding and it genuinely sounds like MØ is fighting a battle of mixed emotions inside of herself.

The Guardian named MØ 'band of the day' and hailed her as 'the next Grimes' and having played alongside acts such as Purity Ring and MS MR, it seems like MØ might just be the next indie act to break through to the mainstream masses.

There is not much info out there on MØ who tends to let her music do the talking, but her facebook biography reveals a glimpse of her current state of mind:

"The snow nation is eating your brain and your young heart – dark as the apocalypse. So just go perish in the snøw. mø mø mø MØ MØ MØ"
title: Rescheduled for March-MØ hits Portland!

	The Endocannabinoid System (eCS)
	Methods of Administration
	Terpenes & Aromatherapy
	Touch Therapy
	Wellness Perspective
	Ending Prohibition- Our Ethnobiological Right

Lunch will be provided

Limited to first 50 registrants.

Bonus!: Includes 1 year subscription to Cannabis Nurse’s Magazine

Certificate Pricing:

$269 Earlybird, $299 Regular,

$320 Cash at the Door

Non-Certificate Pricing:

$240 Earybird, $270 Regular,

$290 Cash at the Door

Developed and Produced by:





Heather Manus, RN is a native New Mexican and Registered Nurse specializing in all aspects of medical cannabis care. As founder of the Arizona Cannabis Nurses Association and fierce advocate for veterans and mental health, Nurse Heather was responsible for the addition of Post-Traumatic Stress (PTSd) as a debilitating condition under Arizona’s medical marijuana act. In 2015, Nurse Heather was honored for her efforts, and awarded the CannAwards “Best Charitable/Community Outreach Program,” and Cannabis Business Awards “Activist of the Year.”

Heather began her career as a Registered Nurse providing psychiatric home health care to patients in New Mexico. Nurse Heather has extensive background and experience in natural healing modalities and herbal remedies, some of which she obtained from her close association with Hispanic and Native American healers in New Mexico. Her vast knowledge and holistic approach to individualized patient care has been the cornerstone of her success as a nurse, educator, and promoter of health.

In both, New Mexico and Arizona, she opened the first licensed medical cannabis infusion facilities to provide cannabis patients with smokeless alternative products. Her newly launched company, Nature Nurse, combines years of knowledge and experience with modern science and research to provide high quality products & services that naturally support the endocannabinoid system and encourage increased health & well-being.

Nurse Heather has presented to shares knowledge nationally and internationally, providing mental health, plant medicine education, and cannabis industry assistance in Alaska, Colorado, Massachusetts, Florida, New Mexico, California, Nevada, Arizona, Washington, Hawaii, U.S. Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, Canada, and Australia. Nurse Heather has been a beloved presenter in the educational, medical, and cannabis industry conference speaking circuits since 2010. Her deep understanding, unique perspectives and professional delivery makes learning a positive and enriching experience. Nurse Heather has been featured and published in several magazines, hosts an online podcast “Good News with Nurse Heather”, and is currently in pre-production for a daytime TV show “Knowledge is Power.”

Nurse Heather travels far and wide, sharing love and knowledge everywhere she goes. She believes that knowledge is power, and strives to empower as many people as possible. As a result, in 2016 Nurse Heather was honored to receive the Cannabis Business Awards ‘Educational Achievement’ Award, and the ‘Leader of Nursing’ Award from Cannabis Nurses Magazine.



Nurse Juhlzie Monteiro, RN, BSK (@AskNurseJuhlzie) is a Registered Nurse in the state of Nevada and a UNLV Alumni. She has worked over twenty years in medicine specializing in Internal Medicine, Orthopedics, Pediatric ER/Trauma (PALS) and Adult ER (ACLS/TNCC), Outpatient Surgery and Pain Management, and a Nurse Educator in many of these specialties. She is the President of Nevada Cannabis Nurses Association (NVCNA), a member of American Nurses Association (ANA) and Nevada State Nurses Association (NSNA). Through American Cannabis Nurses Association (ACNA) she has earned certificates in The Basic Core Curriculum for Cannabis Nursing and The Advanced Curriculum for Cannabis Nursing. She is on the Nurse Advisory Board for Nature Nurse and one of the Founders of Cannabis Nurses Network which is a Global network for Nurses around the world. She is known in the Las Vegas Community as “Ask Nurse Juhlzie” and educates professionals, patients, caregivers, corporations, and legislation on Cannabis Therapeutics and the science behind the plant in numerous platforms. She contributes to the non-profit organizations of Canna-Aid Foundation and Impact Network, and is the Co-creator and Editor of Cannabis Nurses Magazine which are national platforms within the Cannabis Industry to promote cannabis information, education, and research. She is an advocate and voice for the patients and believes “Education is the key” to the success and future of integrating Cannabis into Health and Wellness.

Contact: Julie Monteiro, RN, BSK

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AskNurseJuhlzie/

FB Name: Juhlzie Kilowatt Monteiro

www.CannabisNursesMagazine.com

www.NatureNurseHealth.com

www.CannabisEducationNetwork.com

www.ImpactCannabis.org



Lisa LeFevre, an entrepreneur and educator, has more than 22 years consulting experience in business and healthcare education. Lisa has produced over 100 custom courses, and HR competency systems for global corporations. Invited lectures include six years at The Technical University of Budapest for Executive Leaders as they transition from communism to capitalism.

Lisa began her cannabis advocacy work in Florida in 2014, developing and delivering educational conferences and representing "Florida for Care" at Public Hearings and panel presentations.

Since moving to Pueblo, CO in 2015, Lisa hit the ground running and is the Founding Southern Colorado Chapter Chair of Women Grow connecting, educating and empowering current and aspiring successful independent cannabis leaders.

Excited to build upon and leverage her business and medical background, Lisa will be working with Nurse Heather Manus and Nurse Juhlzie Monterio to launch their Nature Nurse line of products and supporting lines of business to include Cannabis Nurses Magazine and the Cannabis Nurses Network.

Lisa is also working with horticulture and agriculture experts to apply "best practices" to clean grow environments. In August, her family opened a 14,000 sq. ft. cannabis farm in Colorado City. Their farm will introduce global technologies and processes, not yet utilized in cannabis grows to support "clean and green" cannabis and farm environments.

Lisa holds and Executive MBA from the University of Rochester, a BS in Marketing from Rochester Institute of Technology, and is a board certified R(RT) healthcare professional. She is a lifelong learner who enjoys mentoring and championing winds of change as legal cannabis efforts sweep and intertwine nationally, state by state -- and locally.

Lisa is a BIG contributor politically as a high profile activist fighting against prohibition to PRESERVE AMENDMENT 20 AND 64 that defends our right to exist and thrive, and assures patients safe access to high quality medical cannabis products in Colorado.
title: Cannabis for Healing and Wellnes - Portland

Embrace Festival is a 3 day, international, sacred community and social transformation gathering, which will be held May 4-6, 2017 in beautiful downtown Portland, Oregon for those wishing to positively transform their lives, their local communities, and the world. 

༺ Vision ༻

In May 2017,  people from all over the world will gather to share knowledge and wisdom, learn from each other, celebrate, be inspired, and find the tools needed to create and enliven local movements within our communities.  Together we will explore sacred oneness, Christ Consciousness, Buddha Nature, Eco-Spirituality, Social Justice and the way of universal and personal transformation that honors the Divine in all.

We want you there! Please save the date and consider joining us!
 

༺ Venues ༻

Portland Art Museum
Elliot Center
First Congregational United Church of Christ, Portland


༺ Offerings ༻

3-day event including:
~Presentations by over 30 leaders, teachers, authors, theologians, activists, and artists
~Ceremony and Ritual
~Celebration, Dance, Entertainment
~Live Art, Music and Performance
~Sacred Community, Social Gathering & Networking
~Learning, Workshops, & Breakouts
~Additional Leadership Training Track/Certification
~Yoga, Qi Gong, Meditation, Dance, Drum circles
~Village, Tea Lounge, Concessions
 

Join us as we co-create a new vision that we can all take into the world and into our local communities, creating positive transformation at the local and global levels.

Tickets and all the info you need on our website: www.EmbraceFestival.com

RSVP as 'going' to this event page to stay connected and get notified on our exciting updates.

༺ Intentions ༻

Our intention is to engage the hearts and minds of those present in finding the divine in each other and in all things, to inspire and enliven local movements and communities, to celebrate, play, and co-create a deeper vision for the future of a new Christianity and spirituality as a whole. We aim to raise consciousness, build bridges toward unity and sacred oneness, and eradicate the illusion of separation from each other. We invite participants to be open to new music, new liturgies, and new ideas that inspire hopefulness about the future. We invite participants to EMBRACE a global community of people who will share in inspiration and knowledge. It is our intention that practical guidance will be offered so that we might heal ourselves, our communities, and the planet in on-going ways moving forward.

In a world of constant flux and chaos, we must take a moment to recognize the beautiful things that never waver. Our annual return to Paradise allows for these moments.

Music will always bring us together in a world full of forces aiming to pull us apart. It allows for us to celebrate the unity found within our diversity. Life is ever changing - yet here we are, another year around the sun - soon to find ourselves back home, together again. 

Every year, we collectively leave behind the worries and stresses of our everyday lives as we embark on a journey through Paradise. On June 23rd and 24th 2017, we invite you to gather as the United State of Consciousness as we welcome the return of Paradiso Festival at the breathtaking Gorge Amphitheater. We will embrace the fusion of modern technology and nature’s purity in a land where digital meets nature. Prepare to gather from far and wide to embark on the adventure of the summer!

Join us for a weekend of unforgettable fun, awe-inspiring adventures, top notch visual & audio production, and mind-bending music!

description: Many domestic partnerships as well as romantic partnerships, especially long-term ones, are full of challenges. The  tension we accumulate in day-to-day life and the ideas and beliefs we  accumulate about our loved ones or partner can destroys the love and  domestic harmony. It's particularly erodes desire and intimacy we once  felt with our romantic partners. As we stay in partnership the richness  comes from learning how to turn challenges into opportunities for deeper  intimacy. Through small group or family sessions you and your loved  ones/partner will learn how to re-connect to the present moment and  each other, which can literally breathe new life into a romance as well  as our mindsets in daily modern life. These custom sessions  lasts little over 2 hours and are designed to hold the space for  transformation within you and your partner (Romantic partner or family  member).This work is for you if you are interested in:   * Quieting your mind   *  Unlocking your whole body orgasmic potential    *  Awakening your sexual desire    *  Inspired Creativity   *  Ease of Manifestation   *  Dissolving body discomfort or shame around sexuality   *  Relationships grounded in intimacy & connection     *  Being honored and cherished by a romantic partner     *  Cultivating your Feminine and Masculine energy    *  Finding Forgiveness    *  Radiant Beauty    *  A renewable inner well of energy    *  Feeling at home in your body regardless wherever you goThis work is not for you if:    *  You are looking for a magic pill to fix yourself.    *  You are looking for a magic pill to fix your partner.    *  You don’t want to be responsible for transforming your life.    *  You are looking for new sexual techniques to 'get off'.    *  You just want to feel good, without having to feel anything  else.    *  You are attached to what you already know about yourself, or how sex & relationship work.If you or your loved ones booked more than one session, then after  each session a toolkit for the week/homework, a specialized practice  crafted just for you to continue going deeper will be given. feedbacks are encouraged.These sessions can be redeemed in person at Sacred Garden's home studio or on Skype.NOTE: ALL sessions/exercises are fully clothed with no sexual contact.All major credit cards, checks and cash are acceptedClick here for more information about Sacred Garden of Tantra:http://sacredgarden.strikingly.com/
title: 2-4 person Couple/Domestic Harmony with Tantra

Join us for Central City's first Lolita Tea Party!! Have a grand time enjoying high tea with these classy ladies, and learn more about Lolita culture.  A light meal, tea, and desserts will be served at this event.

Tea Party Rules:
1. Although there is no strict dress code for the event, we encourage everyone to dress semi-formal for the duration of the event.

 2. Food will be self-served or "buffet-style", but we do ask that guests be mindful of other guests and not waste any food or take a large amount of one particular type of food.

 3. Tickets may be purchased at the door, but we encourage purchasing tickets online as early as possible as space is limited!

 4. Guests must also have a Central City Comic Con badge to attend the event (in addition to purchasing a ticket online).

 5. After purchasing your ticket online, your name is automatically added to the guest list. You will need to bring an I.D. to check-in at the event.

description:
Sawtooth Estate Winery Presents A Murder-Mystery Dinner

Sawtooth Winery Wine Cellar, 13750 Surrey Lane Nampa, ID 83686

Choose from two dates: Friday, October 27th
or Saturday, October 28th

Murder-mystery dinners begin innocently enough—guests arrive to mingle amid drinks and quiet conversation. As diners munch away, a sudden death interrupts the feasting. A detective arrives to determine who the killer is, inevitably laying blame on one of the audience members. Tablemates work together to prove their innocence and find the real killer through an interactive performance full of hilarious suspects and eye-catching costumes, all the while dining on the included four-course meal paired perfectly with Sawtooth wines.

Tables are set for 8 guests, each table will receive one clue in relation to the murder mystery that they can reveal throughout the dinner-all set within the Sawtooth Winery cellar.

-Menu created and served by 3 Girls Catering

*Prizes will be awarded to those guests who guess the correct murderer and for best costume

$85 per person

description:
Pitanga, Eddy Vents' kizomba and semba instruction program known for developing top social dancers, welcomes back DJ Guelas and for the very first-time special guest, Master Petchu. Join us for a weekend of dancing, food and fun – a true kizomba cultural experience.
Dancers ready to take their dance to the NEXT LEVEL – here’s your opportunity to improve your semba, kizomba and other Afro rhythms. An intensive 16-hour workshop weekend with world class instruction, designed to work your muscle memory, break barriers and plateaus and increase your confidence as you step on the floor no matter where your dance travels take you. Play with the music, become a “smoother” lead or a “lighter” follow, get ready to refine your dance. In order to ensure the best outcomes for all attendees, students will be accepted through an application process as described below. Space is limited.

TICKET PRICES 
*DOES NOT INCLUDE CARD PROCESSING FEES. NO REFUNDS, TRANSFERABLE WITH ORGANIZER APPROVAL ONLY.*

Friday Class – ALL LEVELS (includes Friday social)
• Advance Pass $30, includes Friday social (On sale Monday 11/14/16 through Tuesday 1/31/17)
• Procrastinator Pass $40, includes Friday social (On sale Wednesday 2/1/17 through Friday 3/1/17)
• At the door $50, includes Friday social

Full Weekend Pass – LEVEL RESTRICTED (see application details below**)
• Early Bird Full Pass $100 (The first 5 leads and 5 follows to email dance@eddyvents.com on Monday 11/14/16 at 1PM, PST will receive the special discount.)
• Advance Full Pass $125 (On sale Monday 11/14/16 through Tuesday 1/31/17)
• Procrastinator Pass $150 (On sale Wednesday 2/1/17 through Friday 3/1/17)
• NO DOOR SALES, walk-ups not permitted

SCHEDULE

Friday, March 10th, 2017
• 8pm-9pm Instructor & Class TBA
• 9pm-10pm Master Petchu, Class TBA
• Social 10pm-3am with DJ Guelas ($10 CASH ONLY for non-workshop attendees)

Saturday, March 11th, 2017
• 9:30am-10am Registration
• 10am-7pm (detailed schedule TBA)
• Kizombada - limited space, invitation only, details TBA

Sunday, March 12th, 2017
• 10am-7pm Kizomba (detailed schedule TBA)
• 7pm-9pm Practica ($5 CASH ONLY for non-workshop attendees)

** TO APPLY: Please submit your first and last name, city, phone number, Facebook name/page, a brief (45 words or less) bio describing your Kizomba dance experience to dance@eddyvents.com. All submissions must include a dance video at least 1 minute long. The production quality and performance nature are NOT important. Adequate lighting that allows you to be clearly identified is a must (no dark club videos). Submissions must be received no later than March 1st, 2017.

Presented by Pitanga USA in partnership with Kizomba Culture

Join us in the springtime of 2017 as we open Trillium for our first community gathering: LU’s official Home Warming under a full moon! This special event will be an intimate gathering of just 200 friends and family. 

IMPORTANT: The ONLY way to secure attendance is by supporting our Indiegogo Crowdfunding campaign. Click link above under "Tickets Available" to get them.. Select the $141 Home Warming Party option. Why is this so? First, the land only holds that many people. Second, we are using the ticket sales from this event to help raise the final funds to establish LU's inaugural campus on this magical land. If you believe in the vision we are holding for the future of our community, then grab a ticket via Indiegogo, and show up with your smile, ready to co-create a magical weekend!

This fun filled and deeply connecting weekend includes:
*Camping under the full moon
*Musical Guests & Open Mic Entertainment
*Councilship, collective visioning, & dreamstorm sessions
*Land Service and Stewardship Opportunity
*Yoga, Movement, Meditation and Ecstatic Dance
*Interactive Group Games, Men’s & Women’s Circles
*Hiking on the 30+ miles of trails directly behind the property
*Dancing under the stars including DJ Dakini

Family friendly! No Dogs please!

Your purchase of a ticket through our campaign will generate much of the support needed to really ground this project into being, so we offer Massive Gratitude!

description:
Are you frustrated with never fully achieving your goals?

Does it seem like you are in a never-ending cycle?

Do you think you have done everything you can do, but still nothing changes?

Are you lost with how to start making things happen?

If you answered yes to one of more of these, then the 28 Day Sculpting Challenge is for you!

Learn how to shift words, thoughts and actions to remove the blocks that are holding you back. Use the proven formula of energy magnetism to sculpt your tomorrows.

For 28 days we will be as focused on your success as you are. Now that's something!

February 12th will begin. Will you join us?



28 Day Sculpting Challenge

Utilizing Energy Magnetism to Sculpt the Life You Want to Live





“We are living in the Gestation of Our Actions.

Don’t like what You have grown?

Plant New Seeds!” Marilyn Lawrence











Your 28 Day Sculpting Challenge is a devotion to energy.

In 28 days, you will:


	Gain knowledge of how the energy vibrations you send out via words, thoughts and actions; most of the time without cognizant involvement, is attracting to you the life you are living…both the good experiences, and the not so good experiences.


	Learn how to channel, control and be consciously aware so that you can sculpt the life you want to live, by utilizing the simple Magnetic Formula of the Law of Energy Attraction. 
	
Create a vision of the life you want to live.
	Take proven steps to get there. 

When you become aware of how a simple shift in energy vibrations will change what you attract, you can begin sculpting the life you want to live, rather than have your life “live you.”



Interestingly, and most often, the visions one desires to sculpt for themselves coincide with their mission statement/purposes for life.   


	Receive emails with step-by-step assignments geared at creating the shifts needed to reach your vision in-line with your highest and greatest good for this life. The assignments draw attention to your focus, emphasize your vision, and gently hand you back the steering wheel to your life. 
	Learn to identify triggers that create resistance and stagnant thinking. 
	Learn techniques for letting go of the “gunk” that is holding you back.
	You will receive an email a day for the first two weeks. Three emails a week for the final two weeks. I will be available to assist via email with challenges.

A). Two, 1-Hour Coaching calls-


	1- Hour Coaching Conference Call: Clearing your mind space- Interactive call With Marilyn and Dale.  ($125.00 value). Inclusive of a recording of the call.
	1-Hour Coaching Call: Leveraging Challenges to Create Momentum- Interactive call with Dale Lawrence ($25.00). Inclusive of recording of the call.

B). One, 60-minute Private Session with Marilyn Lawrence, ($75.00 value).

C). Weekly Soul Journey- 5-minute message from Marilyn and/or Dale.

D). 28-Day Sculpting Challenge workbook. ($12.95 value)

E). Membership access to the Private 28 Day Challenge Facebook page. Interact with other participants, gain commodore, share experiences, grow together, boast drive, and watch for exclusive tips from Marilyn and Dale.

F). Sculpted Vision Materializing- (Priceless)

Cost $150.00

In Life- Results Are As Effective As Your Participation.

Don’t like portions of your life?

What have You done to design it? Are you conscious of it?

What are You doing to change it?

Join us virtually for 28 days while we work together to sculpt the way you want your life to be! 



Positive affirmations, attracting what you want to you based on your words, thoughts and actions does work. Modifying behavior to incorporate the practice is the challenge for some. Some still operate in the doubt or judgment mode. Doubt that it will work; I don’t have time for it, and etc. All are your choices.

You may believe what you want to believe, until you believe something else.

We will give you the information, We will leave a trail of breadcrumbs to a brighter tomorrow, and you can decide when you want to follow the path to a happier you.

“Soul already knows where you are to go. This is about triggering that memory.” Dale Lawrence

Marilyn Lawrence www.marilynlawrence.commarilynlawrence257@gmail.com  949-981-5487

Dale Lawrence www.mybeliefsmylife.comdlspeakercoach@gmail.com

Cost- $150.00
title: What Do You Want Your Life To Look Like? What Is Holding You Back?

description:
Mardi Gras: An Ode to NOLA

On a long list of places we'd like to visit New Orleans sticks out as a mutual must on our food lovers bucket list... though there are no plans to physically go to this Creole paradise we thought we'd bring NOLA to our kitchen with this month's Vegan Supper Club...

Menu


	
	First Course “A Taste of Jambalaya”Cajun Spiced Tomato & Red Kidney Bean Terrine, Seared Vegan Andouille with Rice Crisp, Dried Okra and Celery Crumble


	
	Second Course King Oyster Mushroom Rockefeller on Creamy Cauliflower Mac and Cheese Gumbo




	
	Third Course “Po Boy”Hearts of Palm and Creamy Artichoke Salad with Sweet House-Made Pickle, Shredded Lettuce and Tomato
	


	
	Main Course “Fried Chicken, Buttermilk Biscuits & Southern Sausage Gravy”Pulled Jackfruit Croquette served on a fluffy Coconut Fat Biscuit with Peppercorn-Vegan Sausage White Gravy


	
	Dessert Course Banana Foster Pt II
	Seared Chocolate and Banana Cornbread topped with Cinnamon Beignet, Butter Rum Pudding and Chocolate Ganache
	
	
		

		
		
			Muskoka Maple Coffee, Assorted Sloane Teas, along with Sparkling and Flat Water are included.
			
		
	
	The event begins at 7pm and dinner will start at 7:20pm or when most of the guests have arrived.
	
	No alcohol will be served onsite.
	
	Have a gift card or voucher you'd like to redeem? Give us a shout, send us an email at info@urbanacorn.ca or message us and we can process your tickets manually.
	
	In efforts to keep quality high and dinners intimate we are limiting our tickets to 16 seats per dinner. Multiple dates may be posted outside of peak season but as always this is a first come first served kind of system.
	
	IMPORTANT NOTES: Due to the nature of these events modifications for allergies are often not possible. If you have any allergies, please contact us before purchasing a ticket to discuss. Our facility processes dairy, eggs, wheat, shellfish, soy and other allergens; we employ stringent cross-contact practices to avoid any contamination. For more information on our practices please visit our website or send us an email at info@urbanacorn.ca to discuss. All Supper Club tickets are final sale. Thank you
	
	{About Vegan Supper Clubs}
	
	We host a monthly themed Vegan Supper Club in our second level loft kitchen.
	
	What's a Supper Club you ask? Think of it as an informal dinner party meant to encourage guests to mingle, share and celebrate food. Events are 19+, complimentary sparkling and flat water will be provided. Here's a sneak peak of what to expect or check out our Supper Club Gallery.
	
	Are they always Vegan? Yes. We want people to feel included in the discussion around food, culture and the arts and feel making these events vegan will allow more guests to participate. We also do special Gluten-Free editions a few times a year.
	
	{About Urban Acorn LTD.}
	
	Just like an idea, acorns begin small with the hopes of becoming something big, strong and meaningful. This was the initial push behind Urban Acorn LTD. a Flexiatarian Catering company founded by Chef Daniel Holloway and his partner Marie Fitrion.
	
	Inspired by art, music, and using food as a dialogue for social change, Urban Acorn wants to encourage people to broaden their understanding of food and each other with the hopes of building stronger communities.
	
	Their mostly plant-based 'Flexitarian' approach to cuisine, allows them to seamlessly create menus to both omnivores and vegans. Their philosophy is simple, they believe food should unite, not divide people
title: Vegan Supper Club Series: Mardi Gras: An Ode to NOLA

description:
PURA VIDA! WELCOME TO JUNGLE JAM 2017!

Pura Vida is the Costa Rican way of life. It means “Pure Life” and it indicates a desire to live a life full of… well, Life! Jungle Jam seeks to embody the Costa Rican ethos of Pure Life by providing you with an experience that is full. This is not your typical music festival. Alongside the music, we provide the experience of worldwide travel, tropical excursions, relaxing beaches – even a monkey or two, if that’s what you want. We encourage you to take in all that Costa Rica has to offer and make for yourself a life full of life, while experiencing a truly intimate and unique musical experience.

This event listing is for General Admission and Basic VIP Packages.For Hotel Packages, please go to www.junglejam.com/tickets/#Hotel

JUNGLE JAM 2017Jaco, Costa RicaMarch 10 - 12, 2017 / March 9 - 12 for VIP

Featuring performances by Slightly Stoopid, Thievery Corporation, Stick Figure, Twiddle, Fortunate Youth, Zach Deputy, HIRIE, Mike Love, Rob Garza (DJ set), Organically Good Trio, Santos y Zurdo, & Matt Carey

JungleJam.com

description:
Early Bird Tickets On Sale December 1, 2016
IdentityNorth 2017
Now is the time for Canada to step up. We have all the ingredients and participants required to build a future that is the envy of the rest of the world. Strong digital identity technologies, processes and partnerships will be the foundation of a robust digital economy.

We call upon all attendees of IdentityNorth 2017 to seize the opportunity that is before us: affirm Canada’s place leading the development and adoption of robust, scalable, privacy-enhancing digital identity ecosystems that serve the needs of all stakeholders, securing digital transactions.


What is IdentityNorth?
IdentityNorth is the leading event for individuals and organizations interested in digital identity and the digital economy.  It is where Canadian and international leaders come to share the ideas and knowledge that will drive Canada’s digital future.

The conference delivers high value content through its subject matter experts, keynotes and an “unconference” day - a participant driven event where attendees build the agenda and lead inspiring and insightful sessions on contemporary identity topics.





What to Expect:

Day One will be full of presentations by leading identity and digital economy experts from Canada and around the world. That evening we will host The Leaders Dinner, honouring the visionaries who have led and continue to shape the Canadian and global identity space.

Day Two is slightly shorter, as an “unconference”. Drawing upon the incredible expertise of gathered attendees, participants will work together to tackle the hottest topics and thorniest issues facing the industry. Come prepared to challenge the room with the toughest "opportunities" on your plate.




Agenda:
Day 1

Agenda TBA

Evening - Annual Leadership Dinner- Presentation of the Founder of Canadian Digital Economy Awards

Day 2 Unconference

Drawing upon the incredible expertise of gathered attendees, participants will work together to tackle the hottest topics and thorniest issues facing the industry. Come prepared to challenge the room with the toughest "opportunities" on your plate.

description:
What happens when you're newly divorced with kids? You go dating every other weekend! A new kind of relationship comedy! Because after marriage comes dating!

 Written & Performed by Anne Marie Scheffler of Second City Toronto, Just For Laughs, The Comedy Network, SPANK! The Fifty Shades Parody, and Caroline's on Broadway

So you dated badly in your twenties and thirties, and just in the nick of time, you snagged a soulmate and started a family. But now your perfect life has fallen apart- your marriage is over! Did you really just land back on the dating market? What kind of cruel world is this? Do you really need to go through first dates and new lovers all over again? Or is this happening to everybody: sexy confident adults who can have amazing relationships and not be trying to get married and start a family? Cougar town? Utopia? Or just a lot of wine and lingerie? Who are these guys you're dating? A new kind of fun!

Audience Quotes:

Excellent show. Several days later and we're still laughing and imitating Kendra! - J. M.

Such a great night out! Anne Marie, you rocked it with your incredibly honest, hilarious and poignant take on life after marriage. Thank you for bringing your heart and experience to the stage! - G. P.

So awesome - so raw, so brave and SO funny!!! - S. C.

She was unbelievable! - H. S.

GO SEE THIS SHOW!!! You will Not be sorry!!! - B. L.

Anne Marie Scheffler, you and your show are an inspiration to all of us single guys and dolls. Tinder on, Anne Marie. We will always swipe you to the right! - M. W.

Your show is amazing!- M. L.

Last night's performance was fantastic, with a perfect balance of excellent acting, insightful writing, and comedic talent. - S. M.

We saw MILF LIFE CRISIS last night & our cheeks still hurt from laughing. Anne Marie is a comic genius and incredible woman taking on the challenge of midlife dating (after divorce).

YOU SHOULD SEE THIS IF: You are midlife, separated, divorced, dating, or in a relationship, a young guy with a thing for Hot Mamas, or if you just need a good laugh. - D. B.

Anne Marie's show is the funniest hour you will spend in Toronto with your clothes on. I urge everyone to catch her last show. -

M.W.
title: MILF Life Crisis- a sexy comedy about dating again!

description:
EVENT INFO

TechCrunch's legendary meetup + pitch-off event is coming to Tel Aviv! Join us for beer, good conversation, and a battle to the death to see which entrepreneurs can dazzle and excite the judges in under sixty seconds.


	Pitch-Off Competition

Participants interested in competing in the pitch-off will have 60 seconds to explain why their startup is awesome. These products must currently be in stealth or private beta.


	Office Hours

Office Hours are for companies selected to compete in the Pitch-Off. These 15 minute one-on-one talks will be held the day of the event. We’ll hear about your company, give feedback and recommend the best pitch strategy for the 60-second rapid-fire competition. Think of us as Adam Levine on The Voice.


	Pitch-Off Winners

Pitches will be rated by 3-5 judges, including TechCrunch writers and local VCs. First Place will receive a table in Startup Alley at an upcoming TechCrunch Disrupt. Second Place will receive (2) tickets to an upcoming TechCrunch Disrupt. Third Place will receive (1) ticket to the upcoming TechCrunch Disrupt.

VENUE:

Trask - טראסק

Yosef Yekuti'eli 6

Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel

This is a 21+ only event.

AGENDA:6:00 Doors Open

7:00 Programming Starts

9:00 Networking

10:00 Event Ends

How to Become a Sponsor

For more information on sponsorship packages and to discuss becoming a sponsor, please contact sponsors@ techcrunch.com.

And whether you’re an investor, entrepreneur, dreamer or tech enthusiast, we want to see you at the event, so we can give you free beer and hear your thoughts. Come one, come all. It’s sure to be a night to remember.

NOTE: All ticket sales are final and non-refundable. This is a 21+ only event.
