description:
Because a little bit of daytime fun can go a long way...



We Are George, the George Hull Centre’s Young Leaders Group, is proud to host its 3rd Annual FUNdraiser. On Saturday March 25th, pull out your cowboy boots and come get rowdy with us in support of Children's Mental Health. This year we are thrilled to announce the return of CCMA Award nominees, the River Town Saints! They will be lighting up the stage like a ‘Bonfire’ with their radio hits, awesome covers and more before they hit the road for summer festival season!



What's included:

·Drink Tickets

·Live Musical Entertainment

·Fair-inspired eats/treats

·Country music and dancing

·Games

·Opportunity to get to know Toronto’s Young Professional Community

 - Many great prizes including weekend passes to Boots & Hearts and more!



One of the biggest hurdles for anyone suffering from mental illness is overcoming the stigma. It is the number one reason why two-thirds of those living with a mental illness do not seek help. Help us change these statistics. All proceeds will go to The George Hull Centre for Children and Families, named one of the top childrens charities in Canada by the Financial Post in 2016 that serves as an accredited children's mental health centre helping children and families for 30 years.



Hope to see y’all there!

19+

description:
It’s a Saturday, 10:30 a.m., and the kids are already driving you nuts. Why not take them to an affordable, interactive sketch show created for the very purpose of entertaining your children? How about we offer you a cup of coffee too or, better yet, a mimosa! Parents and guardians: Rec Room is here to save your weekend...and maybe your life.

Rec Room, Houston’s newest performance space nestled in the heart of Downtown Houston, introduces GARBAGE ISLAND, a live, interactive sketch performance for children ages 2 - 6. GARBAGE ISLAND premieres Saturday, February 18, at 10:30 a.m. and runs Saturdays through March 11.

GARBAGE ISLAND, written by Abby Koenig and directed by Rec Room co-founder Stephanie Wittels Wachs, is a fun and interactive live show that is both silly and educational. In the vein of children’s sketch shows, such as You Can’t Do That On Television, and The Muppet Show, GARBAGE ISLAND features absurdist humor and improv, as well as audience participation.

GARBAGE ISLAND takes place in a literal garbage dump where off-the-wall characters come to life to solve mysteries using creative and critical thinking skills. There is an underlying message of earth consciousness and rubbish reuse. Local singer-songwriter, Greg Cote, hosts the show as Garbage Man Joe performing original music. Houston actors and Rec Room regulars Dano Colon, Tasha Gorel, and Orlanders Jones, perform as a rotation of multiple characters.

Additionally, the show features pre-recorded video of puppet performance by none other than Houston’s esteemed puppeteer, Joel Orr of Bobbindoctrin Puppet Theatre.

The set and costumes are designed using only found materials to further highlight the theme of sustainability. Costumes are designed by Houston Grand Opera costumer, Clair Hummel.

Children are invited to bring an old toy with them every week that may be used during the performance as an improv piece for the actors. As such, no two performances will be the same and the audience is encouraged to return to see how the show changes each week. Each performance will culminate in a big kid dance party, with Garbage Man Joe and the cast.

Tickets are $10 per child ages 2 and above. Children under 2 are free to sit on their parents’ lap. Parents watch for free! Coffee and mimosas available at the bar.

Rec Room is located at 100 Jackson St. Metered Street parking is available.
title: Garbage Island

description:
In partnership with Washington Township Adult Education, Neighborhood Christian Legal Clinic will be hosting Naturalization Day on Saturday, March 4, 2017.

Naturalization Day aims to address a growing need in the Indianapolis immigrant community -- that of helping low-income Legal Permanent Residents apply for citizenship without the financial burden of hiring private legal assistance. Volunteering Saturday, March 4th, provides a chance to interact directly with clients in a meaningful way and be a part of one of the most significant life events of many immigrants' lives.

In the morning, Staff Attorney Rachel Van Tyle will deliver a briefing on how to properly complete Naturalization paperwork. In the afternoon, volunteers will help clients complete their Naturalization paperwork.

Volunteer opportunities are available for attorneys, interpreters (Burmese, Arabic, French, Spanish, Hakha Chin, Karen, Karenni), law students, and general volunteers.

- Lunch Provided -
title: Naturalization Day

description:
Ottawa Showbox, Ottawa Music Industry Coalition, & JUNOfest present....



SIGHT & SOUND: AN AUDIOVISUAL EXPERIENCE featuring:

Ottawa Showbox presents a fusion of live music and video projections that will electrify the senses and provide the audience with an immersive audio/visual experience. Ottawa veterans Amos the Transparent and musical prodigy Trails, take over The Record Centre stage along with VJ LES666 who will paint the walls with her bizarre video installation.

****************

Amos The Transparent (Ottawa folk rock)https://www.amosthetransparent.com/

"Ottawa music veterans Amos the Transparent have played countless memorable shows, garnering the love and appreciation of fans across this great nation and a reputation as one of the best acts for live music in Ottawa. You could listen to their albums in many different contexts or moods – it’s balance between radio-friendly hooks and melodies along with strong, captivating lyricism helped propel them to the ranks of Canadian indie rock stardom." – Matías Muñoz, OSBX

+

Trails (Ottawa flashback dream psych)https://trailsssss.bandcamp.com/

Representing the promising, talented youth of Ottawa music, Trails is the dreamy project of Allie O'Manique.

"Trails’ dreamy music is comprised of fingerpicked guitar, arriving in starts and stops, and blanketed in airy vocal melodies like a winding mountain hike – up and up, and back down the trail again. This was a voice like a gentle summer breeze. Trails’ music is unconventional in structure, yet satisfyingly poetic – reminiscent, to me, of the disfigured crooning of King Krule, or the sweet singing of Daughter’s Elena Tonra. – McKinley Leonard-Scott, OSBX

+

Visual Installation by LES666

Poster by the incredibly talented Olivia Johnstonwww.oliviajohnston.com

Hosted by ARTIST, NATHAN MOHLE and the THINK RED PROJECT

Back by fantastic demand! Please join us for an afternoon of instructed painting and gorgeous wine, all while making an impact on the San Diego HIV community. The event will be guided by professional artist, Nathan Mohle and will be held at the fabulous Fifty Seven Degrees, which is centrally located in the Middletown neighborhood and has ample on-site and street parking.

Quick facts:

	
	What's included? A guided, two-hour-ish painting class
	
	What's provided? All the necessary materials for painting (brushes, paints, canvas, etc.) and to keep yourself as clean as possible (plastic aprons, plastic table cloths, etc.) 
	
	Do I get to keep the painting? Yes! 
	
	Wait, I don't know how to paint? That's okay, that's why our experienced instructor guides you along, helping you create your painting.
I can't make it but I want to support the cause. That's great -- here's how you can help:

	
Promote: you can help us by sharing this event and getting others to attend. 
	
Donate: if you would like to make a tax deductible donation to Think Red Project, click here.

Event Painting

"San Diego Moonrise"24x30" acrylic on canvasArtist: Nathan Mohle




100% of the proceeds support Think Red Project, a 501(c)(3) registered non-profit that raises funds and awareness for organizations that serve the local HIV/AIDS community. Participants must register, but those who just want to watch or enjoy a glass of wine are also welcome.

For questions please contact Think Red Project; Fifty Seven Degrees has generously provided the space but is not responsible for the event.

description:
“The power of one person and one instrument – engaging and exciting in itself. I believe that’s the root of folk music”. 
With her third album, Apartments For Lovers, Shawna Caspi taps right into those folk roots, stripping away the session musicians and elaborate arrangements of her previous records in favour of a simple, authentic sound – her solo guitar and voice. The result is a collection of songs that is close-up and honest, showcasing her warm vocals, classically-trained fingerstyle guitar playing, and intimate songwriting in a genuine, powerful way.

On Apartments For Lovers, Shawna creates delicate, quiet moments that are vulnerable and accessible even when she’s writing about someone else. Her songs are snapshots – moments that may appear small, but which subtly carry weight and offer greater depth thanks to her well-crafted lyrics.

“Some musicians make songwriting sound less of a craft and more of a life affirming obsession. Caspi’s compositions stand out as beautiful, complex and intricate…” – NOW Magazine, NXNE preview

For 15 years, Shawna has been playing the guitar she bought at the Ottawa Folklore Centre, one of Canada’s best loved music stores. This cherished instrument has accompanied her on tour throughout Canada and the United States, where she has played festivals including the Blue Skies Music Festival, the Summerfolk Festival, the Deep Roots Music Festival, and the Ottawa Grassroots Festival. It was also her constant companion as she played on the long haul trains between Montreal and Halifax and between Vancouver and Toronto as part of the VIA Rail On Board Entertainment Program.

While she never had one particular musical influence growing up, Shawna found inspiration in a wide variety of independent singer/songwriters as she played and sang her way through the folk music scene. Some of these artists are now her peers, and she has shared the stage with several of her favourites, including Rose Cousins, Jon Brooks, James Keelaghan, Old Man Luedecke, Suzie Vinnick, and Garnet Rogers.

“Shawna Caspi has the rare gift of presence that immediately invites audience engagement, from the first strum of her skilled guitar playing to the last exquisite note she sings”. – Andy Frank, co-founder of Roots Music Canada

From cafes, soft-seat theatres, living rooms, festival stages, and yes, even trains, Shawna is making her living singing her stories on tour. She loves the landscapes of her travels and while weaving them into her songs, she has also been portraying them on canvases. Shawna paints one-of-a-kind works of art inspired by the rich scenery she sees and makes them available for sale with her merchandise. Two of those paintings make up the front and back cover artwork for Apartments For Lovers.

Shawna’s Canadian folk roots are an intrinsic part of who she is. In fact, Shawna as a solo musician is exactly who she is as a person – warm, inviting, a storyteller, a traveler, an authentic artist. “And at the heart of everything”, she says, “I’m just a really big music fan”.
title: Shawna Caspi

description:
YettiFest presents: Singer/Songwriter, Buck Johnson, from Alabama- is currently the keyboardist and backing vocalist for legendary rock band Aerosmith and has also toured and recorded with such notable artists as: The Doobie Brothers, Tal Bachman, John Waite, Shawn Mullins, Matthew Sweet, Timothy B. Schmit of the Eagles and many more!  Please join us for a special evening as he brings the tracks from his band's NEW album: "Enjoying the Ride" to the patio of the Bull & Bear Whiskey Bar and Taphouse, in downtown Monterey!!



Buck co-wrote the international hit single for Carlos Santana “Just Feel Better” featuring Steven Tyler from Aerosmith in 2005. He was a member and one of the primary songwriters in the Country band Whiskey Falls which had 2 Top 40 Country singles released from their self-titled 2007 album. Buck also has had numerous songs in T.V. shows and in major film releases.



Buck is excited to announce the release of his debut album in 2016 on Spectra Music Group which will showcase songs that reflect his life journey with all it’s ups and downs. The album consists of the world class musicians Buck has been recording and playing with in Nashville, Tn. There are also guest appearances from notable musicians like Kenny Aronoff on drums, Waddy Wachtel on guitar and Stuart Duncan on fiddle. All the songs were written by the writing team of Buck Johnson and producer/songwriter Charlie Midnight (James Brown, Joe Cocker, The Doobie Brothers, Joni Mitchell, Jamie Johnson, Hillary Duff), with collaborations on “Enjoying The Ride” and “Live For The Song” with hit Nashville songwriter James Hicks. The album is produced by producer/mixer Mark Needham (Chris Isaak, Fleetwood Mac, The Killers), Charlie Midnight and Buck Johnson.



This event is brought to you by YettiFest Productions; hosted by Buich Bros Restaurant Group Inc at The Bull & Bear Whiskey Bar and Taphouse; promotional considerations by Stagod Media, A&R Management For Buck Johnson, and PB&D International. #buckjohnson #aerosmith #yettifest #bullandbearca #stagodmedia 



www.BuckJohnson.com

description:
Course Description

*This is an advanced level course and requires participants to submit a course application and portfolio to complete the registration process. Details will be sent via email upon initial registration.

The 30 hour Ropes Course and Climbing
Program Management training course is designed to help senior adventure program
instructors and program directors manage their ropes course and climbing
programs (tower, wall, or cliff) more effectively. This 30 hour training will
enhance your ability to deliver safe and effective adventure programs by increasing
your understanding of standards, current research and testing, emergency
preparedness and program assessment. The workshop’s experiential approach
enables leadership teams to refine their ropes course and climbing program
management systems and hone their critical incident response plan.

Course Objectives

By the end of this training, ropes course and climbing program management attendees will:


	Appreciate how current standards and practices may inform the operation of ropes courses and climbing programs
	Have the ability to improve their adventure program’s effectiveness by applying research findings, assessment, and evaluation tools
	Apply the key concepts of the injury counter-measures model to their own safety management plan 
	Create more effective management systems for their adventure program using the tools provided in their site’s operations manual 
	Understand the implications of recent research and testing on equipment selection, facility operations, and staff training


We offer two tracks for this training - Certification and Audit. Choose the track that is right for you:

Audit



The skills and concepts taught in the Ropes Course and Climbing Program Management training course are of benefit to any director or program director having supervisory responsibility for the adventure programming aspect at their facility. As such, we provide an “audit” opportunity for those who do not meet the certification pre-requisites. Participants who are “auditing” may participate fully in all aspects of the training, but will not be eligible to participate in the Testing Day. As such their participation will be complete at the end of Day 3.

Certification


	Those individuals who meet the prerequisites for
certification, complete all the course hours, and successfully complete the
practical skills assessment and written test will receive certification as a
Challenge Course Manager, in accordance with ACCT Standards.


	Prerequisites:


	21 years of age
	500 documented hours of
adventure program delivery and management experience
	
	Current certification
as a Level 2 Challenge Course Practitioner (Adventureworks! Associates, Inc. Ropes
Course Instructor or equivalent)
	
	
	Willingness and ability
to perform all tasks related to ropes course and climbing wall operation
including spotting, belaying, climbing on belay, climbing on personal fall
protection to perform set-up / take-down, and performing in-air rescue tasks
	
	


Additional Info:


	Please ensure that you have read and understood the Registration Policies.
	
	If choosing "Course Only" option, course participants are responsible for their own accommodation for the duration of the course. Meals are included in all options.
	Meals include lunch on first day of course, to lunch on last day. 
	This event leads to ACCT Certification.  Please read the Certification FAQ's.
	NEW! Organizations may purchase course seats without registering specific individuals. Registration "tickets" can be transferred at any time to an individual within your organization.
	Taxes and fees including in pricing.
title: Challenge Course and Climbing Program Management

description:
You won't believe these comics have been performing less than 2 years.  You won't believe they are all newbies to the comedy game!

Host Zane Barrett is a Bay Area comedian who is also a scientist. He experiments with cancer cells during the day then experiments with making the funny at night. His material covers everyday life scenarios and the darker side of familiar ideas.  With a little over a year in the scene he is grinding away at becoming a working comic someday.  Zane Barrett has performed at open mics all over the city (Brainwash, Purple Onion, Mutiny Radio, etc) and currently runs the amazing Bomb Shelter open mic.

Hunter Donaldson is a comedian based out of Portland, Oregon who originally hails from Fayetteville, Arkansas. He has been featured on many local Portland comedy showcases and made it to the semi-finals of the Portland Funniest Person contest. He wears sweaters and people like that and he is nice.

Geneva Rust-orta- Geneva first tried stand up comedy in 2015 at the Jewish Comedian of the Year Competition in London, where she was named ‘Second Funniest Jew’. She took a show, ‘Messed Up’, to the 2016 Camden and Edinburgh Fringe Festivals in the UK. She’s new to the Bay Area comedy scene.

I'm Tony Lewis, I am a native to the Puget Sound of Washington State. I have been doing standup for 2 years mostly in the Olympia/Tacoma Scene. I've featured at World Famous Nicks and also in Olympias Pig Bar and also at Le Voyeurs weekly Vomity Open mic. I've been on the podcasts :"Everything is Awesome" and also "The Stationwagon Podcast" as well as hosted my own "The Ye Old Olympic Comedy Hour". I used to do pre-taped sketches with my group Dorsal Fin United. I have performed also at the Olympia Hempfest and took 2nd place at the Northwest Cannabis Comedy Competition.  

Local Mike Evans Jr. Hosts Old Soul Radio a weekly podcast on Mutiny Radio Sunday nights from 10p to midnight .
title: Mutiny Radio Comedy Festival 2017: Newbies (>2yrs)

description:
Forks and Skis is a ski event open to the public for those interested in hitting the slopes while helping Foodlink fulfill its mission of a healthy, hunger-free community.

This is the fifth year for the charity ski event. For the first two years of the event (2013 and 2014), the event was named the Muxy Ski-Off in honor of the late Gary Muxworthy.  Mr. Muxworthy was a sports enthusiast who devoted much of his life to raising money for charities through exciting sporting events.  Over the past four years, the event has raised more than $84,000!

In addition to a day of skiing, there will be lunch, Après Ski, live entertainment from the WillBillys,  a 50/50 raffle, and multiple raffle items including a trip to Panama!

We hope to see you on the slopes on March 3 from 12-5pm at the Bristol Mountain Ski Resort.

Schedule:12 p.m.: Registration and lunch1 p.m.: Open ski 2 p.m.: Open timing (NASTAR) *Top 8 qualify5 p.m.: Apres ski in the lodge.

For Sponsorship opportunities please contact Juliana Stefani at jstefani@foodlinkny.org
title: Fifth Annual Forks & Skis Charity Event

description:
Just like it sounds, these comics will perform in their underwear!  Don't miss this sexy show!

Host Jeff “Anayahuasca” Anaya is a stand-up comedian and visionary living in San Francisco. He has that same charm you've come to expect from Jeffs, but don't be fooled by his demure appearance. He has the mind of a dirty old man and the body of a children's television host. 
Jeff's ribald-but-smart commentaries about awkward dates, unlikely naïveté and the challenges of scraping by in one of America's most expensive cities are both timely and universal. Jeff is a mainstay in the Bay Area comedy scene, and has performed at clubs across the country.

Jason Anderson is a comic from Sacramento, most well known for not getting his grandmother to stop bringing up that time he was on WeTV's Bridezillas.  To gain any other notoriety he took a role on HBO's Silicon Valley and led this led his grandmother to reply "What Valley?"

Piper Shephard- Originally hailing from Memphis, Tennessee and having grown up around parts of rural Alabama, Piper Shepherd is a stand-up comedian, musician, and actor who is currently based out of Denver, Colorado. She has performed on stages all over the state of Colorado as well as various parts of the country since 2014.

Reid Clark- 

Reid Clark gave up his right testicle for comedy. Literally. He talks about it in his set, it’s funny yet uncomfortable like a lot of Reid’s humor. His comedy has been described as dark, blue, and political, with elements of musicality and improvisation. Reid has been doing comedy for 5 years but has been performing his whole life. He has opened for Alonzo Bodden, Neal Brennan, and Trevor Noah at Dead Crow Comedy Room in his home town of Wilmington, North Carolina. Reid also has improv, sketch and writing experience. Reid has written original stage and screen plays and has written jokes for actor Orlando Jones. Reid has written, directed and performed for music videos that have been in film festivals.  Reid has starred in the film Frat Brothers available on Netflix. He has also been the lead in an episode of Fatal Encounters on Discovery ID. Over the past few months Reid has been traveling doing comedy in Denver, San Antonio and currently in Washington DC. Reid has been in the Cape Fear Comedy Festival, a three time finalist in Port City’s Top Comic and a finalist this year of the Funniest In South Texas Comedy Competition at Laugh Out Loud Comedy Club in San Antonio.

Ben Quick- With a thousand-watt smile and a razor-sharp intellect, Ben Quick has a lot on his mind. Combining a wide array of talents from the rhetorical to the musical, Ben's twisted, analytical neurosis brings a high-energy point of view to the stage that’s equal parts undeniable and uncompromising.
title: Mutiny Radio Comedy Festival 2017: Underwear Only

description:
Lukas McFarlane Presents 


UnTitled Dance Company in 


"The Suffocating Truth"



To what length would you go to keep a secret? 

What toll does it take? Does it eat you from the inside?

Sky 1’s  2013 'Got To Dance’ Champion, Lukas McFarlane, is back with his company's second full length show; The Suffocating Truth. Audiences across the UK will be immersed into a world like no other, witnessing one man’s journey into the exploration of sexuality, relationships and feelings of betrayal, pain and love…

During this intimate performance in the round, the audience will be teleported into the mind of Lukas McFarlane, where they will be a part of the dancers struggle to find acceptance, as well as the discovery that every lesson learnt brings them closer to true happiness.

Contains mature subject matter and is recomended at 14+.



SHOWS:

Friday 3rd March 7:30pm

Saturday 4th March 7:30pm

description:
For this two-hour embroidery workshop, artist Dana Prieto will lead an embroidering circle open to anyone who self-identify as women (cis, trans, non-binary, etc.). Women from different ages, social and cultural backgrounds, and professions are all welcome to participate. No previous sewing experience is required. All materials will be provided including: new kitchen cloths, embroidering thread, and embroidering needles. Participants are also welcome to bring their own used or new kitchen cloth, tea towel, or dish towel to embroider. 

Embroidered pieces from this workshop can either be taken home by the participants or donated to Dana's collaborative large-scale textile installation called The Rags Between Us, an exhaustive exploration of rags, kitchen cloths, dishtowels and tea towels donated by family, friends, acquaintances and strangers. The project re-frames and reenacts ordinary cloths into affective materials, actions, and spaces that embody female narratives of alliances and disconnections with cleaning and sustenance. 



Dana has hosted and facilitated three embroidering circles where she collaborated with over 100 women to embroider old and new cloths while engaging in a deeply enriching experience, sharing time, labour, and conversations. In each occasion, our old rags and our most dear female relationships and narratives have been our muses of inspiration.

About the FacilitatorDana Prieto is an Argentine artist and educator based in Toronto. She completed a BFA in Drawing and Painting at OCAD University.

Her work circles around the mundane through the creation of spaces, images and actions that propose uncanny participatory experiences. Using ordinary materials such as food, litter and kitchen cloths, her projects reflect on both intimate and social-political issues around migration, belonging, gender and power.

She has participated in several award-winning collaborative projects working within diverse communities in Toronto, Halifax, Buenos Aires, Rawson, Quito and Belize.



She is currently coordinating Critical Soup, an interdisciplinary food-art initiative that opens dialogues about the impacts of Canadian extractive companies in Indigenous and Global South territories.

Find out more on her website.

Image: © 2015 Dana Prieto.
title: SA Creates: Embroidery Workshop

description:
Get ready as we improvise your relationship.

It's the most fun you'll ever have on date night!

Two lucky couples will see their love unfold on stage through the interpretation of 2 of Hampton Roads' wackiest improvisers!

The couples will be selected at random and interviewed on stage in front of the audience. Using the information they learn, and their imagination, Brad and Alba will show the story of the couples' love.

For years, The Pushers have been getting to know diverse couples all across Hampton Roads with this signature piece. Normally this is a piece within a larger show. This time, Brad and Alba are out to explore as much as possible by bringing it to you as its own show!



Getting to Know the Couple: With Brad and Alba

Friday, March 3rd at 8pm

Tickets are $5

---

The Pushers are Virginia's premiere sketch and improv comedy group. For more than 11 years they have thrilled (and shocked) audiences with their wild antics both on and off stage. The group puts on a racy, high-octane, energetic show that is guaranteed to have audiences howling with laughter. In November of 2014, they opened their own theater, The Push Comedy Theater, located in the new Norfolk Arts District.

In 2013 The Pushers' Off-Broadway musical Cuff Me: The Unauthorized Fifty Shades of Grey Musical Parody debuted in New York City. It ran for over a year in both New York and Chicago. A third production is currently touring the country.

The Pushers have appeared at both The Charleston Comedy Festival and The North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival. In New York, they have performed at The People's Improv Theater, The Upright Citizen's Brigade and at The Kraine Theater in New York's East Village.

Here in Hampton Roads the group have performed most notably at The Jewish Mother, The NorVa and The Virginia Beach Funnybone.

---

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.
title: Getting to Know the Couple: with Brad and Alba

description:
Annually, the Hill Country Film Society hosts a fundraiser that pairs local cuisine, Texas Hill Country wine and film for an inspiring evening. In partnership with Hoffman Haus, Otto's German Bistro and Pedernales Cellars, Film Affäre will explore the convergence of food and film with guest speaker, Tom Provost.

Provost is an award winning filmmaker, author of the engaging blog, On Food and Film, and is also the creator and instructor of the popular filmmaking series, Cinema Language. Provost will share his insights on how food can influence our perspective of cinema and vice versa. Inspired by and paired with Provost's film inspirations - you will enjoy five small courses prepared by Chef Judd Wood of Otto's German Bistro, Pedernales Cellars wine, and of course, film.

Film Affäre event details:


	Friday, March 3, 2017 at 6 p.m.
	Hoffman Haus | 608 East Creek Street, Fredericksburg, Texas
	This culinary and cinematic journey will include Pedernales Cellars wine and five small courses prepared by Chef Judd Wood of Otto’s German Bistro - inspired by and paired with Provost’s film inspirations
	Proceeds benefit the Hill Country Film Society's year-round programming: the Hill Country Film Festival, Indie Film Series and Summer Film Camp
title: Film Affäre

description:
BACK BY POPULAR DEMAND! ONE FINAL SHOW ON 35MM!

Doors 7:00 / Film at 8:00 SHARP!

Imagine a world where people’s worst impulses and darkest desires are stimulated by a landscape of synth-pop and bright neon lights. Nothing is quite as it seems as you surrender yourself to the dazzling sights and soothing sounds of the Neon Dreams Cinema Club, a monthly film series exclusive to The Royal Cinema bringing you the best in delightfully surreal neo-noir cinema from the 70's, 80's, and beyond.

The evening will kick off at 7:30 with a mind-blowing 80’s music video pre-show party before starting the feature presentation at 8:00. There will also be prize giveaways and swag, so roll up those blazer sleeves and get there early!

---

Raven Shaddock (Willem Dafoe), along with his gang of merciless biker friends, kidnaps rock singer Ellen Aim (Diane Lane). Ellen's former lover, soldier-for-hire Tom Cody (Michael Paré), happens to be passing through town on a visit. In an attempt to save his star act, Ellen's manager, Billy Fish (Rick Moranis), hires Tom to rescue Ellen. Billy and Tom, along with former soldier McCoy (Amy Madigan), battle through dangerous cityscapes, determined to get Ellen back.

“Streets Of Fire, is, by design, comic book in orientation, mock-epic in structure, movie-heroic in acting style, operatic in visual style and cowboy-cliche in dialogue. I tried to make what I would have thought was a perfect movie when I was in my teens – I put in all the things I thought were great then and which I still have great affection for, custom cars, kissing in the rain, neon, trains in the night, high-speed pursuit, rumbles, rock stars, motorcycles, jokes in tough situations, leather jackets and questions of honor.” -Walter Hill, director of Streets Of Fire
title: Neon Dreams Cinema Club: STREETS OF FIRE on 35mm!

description:
The director of Sombre, La Vie nouvelle, and Un lac returns with his latest investigation of extreme experience. English musician Lenz (Kristian Marr) searches for a woman named Madeleine who has mysteriously disappeared, but tumbles into an amour fou with troubled, self-destructive Hélène (French indie It-Girl Ariane Labed). Grieving the loss of her infant son, Hélène seeks oblivion in the murky subterranean world of a brutal sex ring, followed by Lenz. Also featuring Roxane Mesquida and Paul Hamy, this darkly erotic psychodrama with a stark, elliptical, hauntingly spectral narrative (co-written by Grand Central director Rebecca Zlotowski) continues Philippe Grandieux’s exploration of the body initiated with White Epilepsy in scenes of sensual abandon and raw carnality.

“A writhing depressive's Gaspar Noé, Grandrieux is all about the fleshy moments, and here they're all tinged with doom.” – Michael Atkinson, The Village Voice

“Despair and ecstasy erupt from the fabric of the film with a blistering, almost physical intensity.” - Sean Nam, Slant

“A cerebral, extrasensory experience, existing as a diluted nightmare where pleasure and punishment are doled out in equal measure” Nicholas Bell, Ioncinema
title: MDFF: MALGRE LA NUIT

description:
Ampersand is a collaborative monthly concert series hosted by WMBR & the List Visual Arts Center at MIT. Musicians perform in Bartos Theatre, accompanied by visual art that they have created or curated.

Doors: 7:30PMShow: 8PM (ends by 10PM)Tickets: $5 (http://universe.com/ampersand-23), $3 w/MIT ID (cash @ the door)More Info: http://wmbr.org/ampersand

Miles OkazakiMusic: https://soundcloud.com/milesokazakiVideo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-cE3fgdFZ8Y

Miles Okazaki is an American guitarist and composer - a Washington native in NYC since '97. Trickster, his 4th album of original compositions will be released later this year. As a sideman, Okazaki has recently worked with Steve Coleman, Jonathan Finlayson, Amir El Saffar, and many others. He will be acompanied by Swiss born saxophonist, composer, and educator María Grand. Recently she became the protégée of legendary musicians such as Steve Coleman, Billy Harper, Antoine Roney, and Von Freeman. Okazaki and Grand will present music arranged for duet, focusing on layered rhythms, melodic counterpoint, and improvisation within forms written for recent projects. Many of these compositions are modular in nature and will be used to build larger forms with elements that are introduced by the other musicians.

RAJASMusic: https://soundcloud.com/rajnaswaminathan/sets/rajasVideo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yin6_RB8vXU

RAJAS brings together contemporary musicians from the Indian classical and jazz/creative music scenes in NYC and is led by Rajna Swaminathan. The Vedantic term rajas refers to the inner human energy that compels us to act, to pursue our passions, to create, and to preserve ourselves. Through collectively improvised textures and rhythmically centered explorations, the musicians of RAJAS contemplate new possibilities for musical ideas and sensibilities at the nexus of multiple creative traditions.

Don't forget to stop by before the show starts to check out the List Gallery upstairs. Free admission!
title: Miles Okazaki & Rajas: Contemporary Jazz Improv

description: The Bloomfield Symphony Orchestra with the Bloomfield Chorale present a concert featuring the music of Schubert, Balakirev and others.  The Symphony Orchestra will perform the Symphony No. 8 in B minor, D 759 (Unfinished) and Overture on Three Russian Themes by Mily Balakirev.  The Chorale will join the Symphony for selections from Schubert's Mass in G Major, D. 167.  The Chorale will then present several selections of its own. description:
The one and only feature film directed by Saul Bass, the most innovative and influential graphic designer of the 20th century – you know his work from the title sequences and posters for films like Vertigo, Some Like it Hot, West Side Story, The Shining, Anatomy of a Murder and Casino,  and for creating the shower sequence in Psycho – PHASE IV is one of the most unique and chilling sci-fi horror stories ever etched to celluloid, with a haunted visual intensity and insect “performances” more downright startling than any other in filmdom. In the words of its maker, Phase IV is “a sort of sci-fi, surrealistic, ecological suspense story… a confrontation between man and other species – in this case ants – over the apportionment and control of the resources of Earth.”

The screenplay by Mayo Simon (Futureworld) begins when an unknown cosmic event thrusts ants into a rapid evolution, and they develop a true hive mind. A scientific team investigates the strange Stonehenge-like towers and geometrically perfect designs constructed by ants in the deserts of Arizona, as the local human population flees for their lives. Two scientists set up a computerized lab in a sealed dome, and take in a woman fleeing in refuge. As they study the ants, finding ways to communicate with and combat them, they realize that they themselves are the ones under a carefully controlled surveillance.

Ostensibly part of the sub-genre of eco-horror films that proliferated in the 1970s, Kingdom of the Spiders (1977), Empire of the Ants (1977), The Swarm (1978), here the approach is arty, cerebral, and continually visually arresting – an “ant art film”. The remarkable close-up ant photography was shot by Ken Middleham, the insect cinematographer of the 1971 pseudo-doc The Hellstrom Chronicle. Phase IV takes that documentary's premise – that insects will win the battle for global dominance, not mankind – and dramatizes it in a way that is often disturbingly plausible. Puzzling to an audience that expected more of a Cold War sci-fi scare flick like Them!, and maybe a little less 2001: A Space Odyssey via Cronenberg’s Stereo and Crimes of the Future, Phase IV was destined for cult classic status. Once seen (especially on the big screen!), it will linger, fear and inspire forever.

Breathtaking and chilling – don’t mess with the ants!
title: Robots vs Unicorns: PHASE IV

description:
Rick Sacks leads The Array Ensemble in a program of pieces written for Arraymusic. The title for the concert is also the sub-title of Rudolf Komorous’ piece Dame’s Rocket (The Rainbow of Forgetting 2). Its combination of evocative beauty and elusive obscurity is very much in keeping with Komorous’ estetiku divnosti, his “aesthetic of curious things” / “aesthetic of the strange” / “aesthetic of the wonderful.” Komorous developed this philosophy with a group of like-minded artists in Prague during the late 1950s. In an interview he explained that "the group's main philosophy was that things should somehow be driven on the edge—on that edge when you cannot really recognize what's serious, what's not serious; you know, what's true, what's not true; what's sort of from life and what is a sheer imagination. Simply that edge—because we thought that on that edge real things happen.” This concert brings together six extremely different—wonderfully different—pieces of music. Yet all this music, in utterly distinct ways, is driven on the edge, moves along and inhabits that edge, and encourages the listener to join it there.
PROGRAMME

Martin Arnold: (Damper) Coaster (2000)

Linda Bouchard: Ductwork (1997)

Rudolf Komorous: Dame's Rocket (the rainbow of forgetting 2) (1991)

Marjan Mozetich: Time to Leave (1997)

John Mark Sherlock: Necklace (1997)

Linda Catlin Smith: Stare at the River (2010)
title: Rainbow of Forgetting

Throughout the evening, we'll cover topics like clean cosmetics, the therapeutic potential of different ingredients, essential oils, DIY Beauty, issues to be aware of in the cosmetic industry such as green washing, and so much more. At the end of the night, we'll make 1 surprise DIY Beauty Recipe together, which will be a take home. Healthoholics will have tea on hand to make for a lovely night out!

When: March 7, 6:30-8:30pm

Where: Healthoholics

Cost: $10

Be sure to get your tickets before hand to secure your seat! Only 30 tickets available!

About The Eco Well

The Eco Well is a Waterloo based skincare business. Along with the production of eco-friendly, therapeutic & vegan products, half of their business is dedicated to public education about cosmetics. The Eco Well does public talks and DIY Beauty lessons throughout Ontario. They are committed to evidence based and transparent practices. Learn more at www.TheEcoWell.com.

This conversation will be led by Jen Novakovich, a Waterloo based health educator and owner of The Eco Well. Jen studied Nutrition and Nutraceuticals at the University of Guelph and has been working in the Natural Health industry for the past 5 years, working in research, education, sales and writing. She is passionate about clean cosmetics, science communication and public education

.

Ganja White Night (Brussels, Belgium) [Dubstep / Hip-Hop / Live Performance] {SubCarbon Records}

Tunes: https://soundcloud.com/ganjawhitenightFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/GanjaWhiteNight/

Ganja White Night is an electronic music band whose early influences are found at the roots of "Bass-Music". During the past decade, the duo traveled many countries in Europe and made several tours in the United States. The band takes a new creative direction tinted with hip-hop and more generally hybrid electronic music after the release of their fourth album "Addiction" in 2014.

They decided to break the fetters that connected them almost exclusively to "Dubstep" and started using other forms of expression. It is therefore with their new album "Hybrid Distillery" that the group now has to make an impression by imposing its style in other genres of electronic music. This fifth album is not only another acoustic chapter, it is also about graphics. The draftsman/graffiti artist/director "Ebola - Delit2fuite" brings a whole new visual world mixed with, just like Ganja White Night, artistic originality and singularity never achieved until now.

Boogie T.

More info TBA

description:
Join fellow Chicago actors for a hands on, in the booth, VO practice session at Foxhole with Kathleen Puls Andrade.

Kathleen has been a working voiceover with Innovative Artists and NV Talent since 1997. Her specialty is “real people”, warm and conversational reads, characters and technical/medical language. (Yeah, that’s a thing!) She has co-created and currently teaches the Beginning Voiceover for Improvisers and the Advanced Voiceover programs for the Second City Training Center, Chicago. The program uses improvisation as a tool to making creative decisions on the spot.

She also teaches workshops like The Voice Actor's Bootcamp, for Second City Training Center, Chicago, and is the Producing Director of the SCTC Original Sitcom Contest and SCTC Comedy Screenplay Contest.

In addition to Second City, she has taught Voiceover to Discover Card, Bosco Productions, and the Baylor University Theater Department. You can hear her demos and more of her work at www.gingrworks.com.

To assure ample time in the booth, this session is limited to just 13 people.

Each attendee will be emailed a link to review what you tracked in the booth.

In classic Foxhole style, feel free to bring some wine or beer for a breif BYOB social gathering following the workshop.

description:
BOOK RESTORATION WORKSHOP

Participants will be taught basic book repair techniques, and in the process learn about the book's components and traditional hand bookbinding methods. They will dissect a book and reassemble it. Participants will deconstruct the book by detaching the covers and spine; removing the sewing, and disassembling the text. They will then reconstruct their book by performing page repair; resewing the text; and rehinging the covers and spine.



The book along with all additional materials are included, and tools will be provided.

Cost per Person: $100/Adult (Age 14 and Up).

**Fee reduced to $85 if you bring your own pre-approved book to work on.  

Class size is limited to 6 people. Participants must be over the age of 14. Participants under 18 must be accompanied by an adult.

Length of Class: Typical class lasts about 5-6 hrs

To review the Workshop Registration & Cancellation Policies, please visit: http://goo.gl/JzQINw.



UPCOMING CLASS DATES



Saturday, April 22, 2017: 9AM – 3PMSaturday, September 30, 2017: 9AM – 3PM



**In order to obtain approval and discount code, please email the following photos of your book to famccarrick@historicsugartown.org: 1. Front Cover, 2. Spine, 3. Back Cover, 4. Front Inside Hinge, 5. Back Inside Hinge, 6. Pages that need to be reinserted. 

The approval process only occurs during business hours and may take a few days.
title: Book Restoration Workshop

description:
What will come out of the Hell Hat?  Whatever you put in it.  The audience writes anything they want on notecards that the comedians will seamlessly work into a set before your very eyes!  MAGIC!

Host Mean Dave is a Californian comedian from the SF Bay Area with a rock and roll style for any occasion or function. Starting with a background in music, Mean Dave was a musician of many years who found he was a comedian the way Happy Gilmore thought he was a hockey player who found himself to be a golfer. With a manic, intelligent approach to material about modern day life, you will be thoroughly entertained with clean-to-adult humor about a variety of subjects. Mean Dave has performed regularly at San Jose Improv, San Francisco Punchline, LA Comedy Store, Tommy T's in Pleasanton and all kinds of shows and events all over.

James Barela- Portland comedy stalwart, James Barela, metes out his comedy in a visceral exploration of turbulent sexuality, lurid cautionary tales, Mexican quirks, and psychedelic cosmic wall-banging. The son of a palm reader and a sheet metal worker in Oklahoma, Barela lived in New York City for several years before settling in Portland. Delivered with a teddy bear's likability, James Barela's comedy will bring you into his unique and vulgar perspective.

Alex Gimapapa- A Boston-based comic, Alex Giampapa began performing stand up at 19 and has since come to share stages with industry heavyweights like Bill Burr and Adam Devine. Alex was recently featured in The World Series of Comedy, a national stand up competition. With his unique-but-relatable style and approachable demeanor, Alex manages to make personal material reach audiences aged 9 to 99. Alex won the 4th Grade Francis Wyman Elementary School Spelling Bee and his mother is very proud.

Evelyn Erie Diamond

Stephan Massih
title: Mutiny Radio Comedy Festival 2017: HELL HAT!

description:
Everyone is invited to An Evening of Live Storytelling hosted by Touch Network at Bournemouth's very own Little Pickle Deli Cafe.
You can listen to local people share their own real life stories in an intimate, relaxed and informal setting.

Because it’s International Women’s Day, we will be hearing from local women who will be talking about their personal experiences in life. We will hear about what they’re doing in Bournemouth, how they got to where they are and why it has impacted them in their life. All talks are intended to be real and honest, not shying away from the difficult stuff, so you can expect to come away feeling hopeful, touched and inspired.

There will be snacks and drinks available to purchase at the cafe.

Tickets are £5 per person (with any profits going back into the social enterprise Touch Network to continue our work) and you can book them here on Universe!

We're looking forward to seeing you there!

Here's some feedback from a guest who attended one of our Evening of Live Storytelling events in Southampton:

"Thank you so much for putting on this wonderful event. I found the whole evening incredibly inspiring. All the speakers were clear and easy to listen to. Each story was very personal and so encouraging to hear how they had managed to come through some very difficult times with such a positive attitude for the future. It made me feel that with the right belief in ourselves and a mindset that says "I can give this a try" we can all accomplish so much."

description:
Get the Facts: How to find the truth in your media
Ready to make a difference where it counts? For teens and young adults today, that means working with IMAGES: art, photos, and video. In this 60-minute webinar, you'll be introduced to how your students can learn the language of images. You'll help them decode media messages, and allow them to see without believing. You'll watch their eyes light up when they see they can rise above the manipulative language of the media. 



Are you a teacher who wants to:


	Make a real difference in a student's life?
	Find new ways to help teens enjoy learning?
	Teach teens and young adults how to find the truth in any picture or video?
	Help students be mindful when consuming media?

If you answered “yes” to any of the above, register for Labragirl Media Project's introductory media literacy education webinar, "Get the Facts".

TAKE AWAYS

You will come away from this workshop with:


	Introduction to picture reading and decoding media messages;
	An understanding of how to rise about the manipulative language of the media;
	Knowledge about the new field of media literacy education; and
	New approaches to make learning both fun and meaningful. 

You'll inspire them to use their smartphone for good, by enabling them to engage with media on an empowering and critical-thinking level.

ABOUT THE FACILITATOR, LAURIE CHIN SAYRES:
Laurie Chin Sayres teaches teens and young adults how to read pictures and decode media messages. A classroom teacher and video editor, Chin Sayres gives students the tools to help them think for themselves, rise above the manipulative media, and create the next generation of inspiring communication.

Read more about Laurie Chin Sayres:


	Director of Media Literacy Education
	
	Boulder's 40 Under 40: Laurie Chin Sayres﻿

Curious? Have questions?

Contact Laurie Chin Sayres at laurie@labragirlmediaproject.com or set up a time for a free 30-minute chat by clicking HERE.

Register now!

Register for Get The Facts below.

NOTE: The webinar is limited to 20 participants.




	Date:
	
	
		Thursday, March 9, 2017
	


	Time:
	
	4:00PM-5:00PM
	


	Location:
	
	
		Online   Note: A webinar URL link will be sent to you the afternoon of the webinar.
	


	General Entry Price:
	
	
		Free
		
	



After you register, your email will be added to Labragirl Media Project's e-newsletter list. You can unsubscribe at any time. You will receive an email with the URL for the webinar a few hours before the meeting time.
title: Get the Facts: How to find the truth in your media [Free 60 minute Webinar]

description:
We are thrilled to be partnering with Strategy of Mind for this three part series on using the science of leadership to explore the Human Quotient, Mission-Driven Leadership and Managing Stress.

Dinner included


Strategy of Mind is a global leadership and team development firm based in Boston. The company specializes in building the Human Quotient, a concept they created that refers to a unique set of evidence-based qualitative skills crucial for professional success. They work across a diverse range of industries and with companies of all shapes and sizes.

David Brendel, Co-founder: David is a certified executive coach, psychiatrist, and philosophical counselor. David specializes in coaching executives and other high-level professionals on leadership development and career transition. David writes about his approach to coaching in frequent blog articles for the Harvard Business Review and other publications. David earned an MD from Harvard Medical School and a PhD in philosophy from the University of Chicago.

Ryan Stelzer, Co-founder: Ryan is a management consultant who specializes in both individual and organizational performance improvement. Prior to his work in consulting, Ryan served at The White House as a Presidential Management Fellow during the Obama Administration. Ryan holds a master's degree from the University of Chicago and undergraduate degrees from Boston University and the University of Cambridge in the UK. He has written articles for various publications.
title: Science of Leadership

description:
It's the last show of the festival and after 25 shows in 5 days, these comics can barely stand-up.

Host Mike Evans Jr.

Erik Escobar- Described as hilariously witty by most and "demented" by his 4th grade teacher, Erik Escobar is a comic that performs all throughout the US at clubs, colleges, and festivals both independently, as a part of the Almost Asian Comedy Tour, and opening for acts such as WWE’s Rob Van Dam and Seinfeld’s Jerry Seinfeld. Credits include NBC's Last Comic Standing, VH1's Walk of Shame Shuttle, Buzzfeed, and the upcoming documentary Where Have You Gone, Lou Dimaggio? You can also check out his Spokane, Washington based upcoming series, Content, at Instagram.com/enjoyCONTENT. His quick delivery and awkward edginess has made him a rising act you will not want to miss. He currently resides in Los Angeles, California with his dog, Rancor, and can be seen (most)every Friday at LA's The Improv Space Theatre with his improv team, Bankroll, or throughout the country at comedy clubs and in the audience at independent wrestling promotions.

Tanya Nascimento is an stand-up comedian/hero/dog queen based in Austin where she has performed for the past 2 years. She has been featured on Trill Comedy Festival and Come an Take It Comedy Festival. She runs a wacky comedy game show at the Mohawk in Austin called Spun Out, which features a big ass wheel comedians love to spin

Scott Kidd is not your typical comedian. He hails from Cajun Louisiana and is quite spicy! Burning opponents in joke competitions, keeping it hot and steamy on stage, and sizzling audiences with his unique sensibilities. From the Funny Bone, to the Hollywood Improv, Scott keeps the crowd on the edge of their seat with amazing impressions, original music, deep cutting sharp wit, and spectacular stage presence. Though he's modest and humble, Scott Kidd has made appearances with Death Squad, Bad News Weekly, Roastbattle, Jay and Silent Bob, Dolph Lundgren, Idiotest, and many more! His latest contribution to comedy, is the new hit series, "Jack Jimminy : Porn Star Extra" from the universe of Dromebox Labs. He can warm your heart or light your ass on fire!

Jake Breslauer is a comedian, producer and writer. He performs Improv and stand up comedy and has played on some of biggest stages in Los Angeles including the Comedy Store and Viper Room Main Stage shows. He’s also had numerous articles published by Huffington Post. He currently resides in Portland Oregon and tours the country doing standup.

Alayna Becker is a Portland-based stand-up comedian, writer, and actor. She is a primarily autobiographical and political comic from a queer and female perspective. She frequently does showcases and shows in the Northwest and across the country. Follow her on twitter @Alayntron
title: Mutiny Radio Comedy Festival 2017: Last Comic Leaning

description:
Tim & the Glory Boys are headed your way on their 2017 HOOTENANNY tour!

Tim Neufeld (also of the band “STARFIELD”) is a multiple JUNO, Dove, and Covenant award winning Christian artist based out of Abbotsford, British Columbia. He and the Glory Boys (A world-class Canadian bluegrass trio) have shared the stage on cross-Canada tours with artists such as Third Day, and most recently, his worshipfulness, Chris Tomlin. Now, starting September 2016, they’re hitting the road on their biggest headlining tour to date, bringing their ‘Worship Hoedown’ to your backyard!

What is “Worship Hoedown” you ask?

It’s a bluegrass inspired night of music and joy... beards, banjos, and blessings for the whole family! A night of corporate worship; with hymns, choruses, original songs, and comedy, geared towards all ages and denominations. It’s Baptists, Pentecostals, Catholics (and everything in between). It’s the local churches coming together to worship in unity, It’s a HOOTENANNY!
title: The HOOTENANNY! Tour | Swift Current, SK

description:
Learn to skate from the Gotham Girls Roller Derby coaches! If you are a female between the ages of 6 and 11 years and want to learn to skate and play roller derby, this is the class for you!

We will cover roller skating basics and introductory roller derby skills. You will need your own skates, knee pads, elbow pads, wrist guards, helmet, and mouth guard. We have some loaner gear but must know ahead of time if you'll need it, availability is not guaranteed.

No skating skills are necessary, but you must be able to make it around the track without holding onto walls or people.

This Basics & Beginners class consists of 11 weeks of classes on Sunday mornings from 9-10 am at our "Crashpad". Classes are cumulative and must be purchased as an 11-week package.

First day: Sunday, January 8th, 2017Last day: Sunday, March 19th, 2017

The cost of this 11-week session is $176.

At the end of the session, there will be a Skills Assessment to determine scrimmage readiness, which will allow movement up into our advanced classes.

**Tickets are NON REFUNDABLE and NONTRANSFERABLE***Session may be canceled and participants' money refunded if there is not enough interest (10-skaters minimum)*



Photo by Sean Hale
title: Gotham Girls Junior Derby Winter Session Basics & Beginners 6-11

description:
BACK FROM SHORE LEAVE! A RESCHEDULED SCREENING OF ON THE TOWN!

Follow three sailors (Gene Kelly, Frank Sinatra, and Jules Munshin) on shore leave in New York, New York in one of the greatest musicals of all time, the MGM spectacular, On the Town! The 1949 musical reunites Singin’ in the Rain directors Kelley and Stanley Donen, and features music by Leonard Bernstein (West Side Story), who wrote the original score for the stage, and Roger Edens (A Star Is Born). On the Town also stars Vera-Ellen, Betty Garrett, and Ann Miller, and won the Academy Award for Best Music. Join Musicale on March 19 for the highly anticipated milestone: our first Gene Kelly movie—and our second Frank Sinatra!

MUSICALE – (noun) a program of music performed at a party – is a monthly film series at The Royal that celebrates everything from 1950s musicals to hip hop documentaries!
title: Musicale: ON THE TOWN

description:
UX STRAT Europe is a conference that brings together experience design leaders, strategists, researchers, and senior professionals to hear about and discuss the latest trends in strategic UX / CX / Product / Service Design. Presentations will focus on the intersection of business strategy, user experience, customer experience, product design, and service design. Join us for an event that will help you take experience design to the next level in your organization.

TO PAY BY INVOICE INSTEAD OF ONLINE, CONTACT US.

See www.uxstrat.com for updates about presenters, program, schedule, etc.

This intimate conference will foster meaningful and lasting interactions among a highly experienced community of Experience Design professionals. The format will be SINGLE-TRACK plenary sessions, so that the attendee experience will be more like a thinktank than a series of passive lectures. There will be ample time for discussion and networking. UX STRAT provides the perfect environment to meet with thought leaders in a pivotal industry that will surely leave its mark on digital business practices in the years to come.

The Tobacco Theater is in the heart of Amsterdam, near Rokin. There are dozens of restaurants and bars within a short walking distance. This will provide the perfect setting for after-hours networking and fun.

Dates and Prices:

When: June 15 and 16, 2017

Where: Tobacco Theater in Amsterdam

Pricing:

Two-Day Conference (June 15 and 16, 2017):

- Super Early (first 30 registrations): 695 euros

- Early (next 50 registrations): 795 euros

- Normal (remaining registrations): 895 euros

UX Strategy Workshop (June 17, 2017)

- Full day workshop: 375 euros

The tickets listed on this page can only be purchased by people representing businesses in the Netherlands with a valid NL VAT number. VAT is reverse charged, but you are still responsible for paying or claiming VAT apart from the ticket purchase. If you want to discuss this, please contact us: info@uxstrat.com.

Sponsorships:

UX STRAT Europe has been organized specifically for experienced UX/CX/Product Design/Service Design leaders, strategists researchers, and designers. This is a great audience for recruiting senior UX / CX talent, as well as for getting the message out that your company is serious about strategic user experience design. For sponsorship information, contact us.

Connect with us:For more information about the conference, contact us at info@uxstrat.com.

Event Cancellation:In the unlikely event that the UX STRAT Europe conference needs to be cancelled because of weather, sickness or other unexpected event, UX STRAT will completely refund the price for registration. No other liability will be incurred or accepted by UX STRAT in the event of a cancellation.

description:
We are pleased to present two guided tour of the Suzy Lake exhibit at the Ryerson Image Centre

Tuesday May 2nd at 11am

Tuesday June 6th at 11am

This exhibition celebrates the career of Canadian artist Suzy Lake, 2016 Scotiabank Photography Award winner, renowned internationally for her work on self-representation, female identity and the aging body. Presented by Scotiabank, organized by the Ryerson Image Centre, and is a primary exhibition of the Scotiabank CONTACT Photography Festival.

The Ryerson Image Centre is an international centre of excellence at Ryerson University, dedicated to the exhibition, research, study, and teaching of photography and related media such as new media, installation art and film.

The tour will last about 1 hour. Babies and walking children are welcomed. Strollers and/or baby carriers can be accommodated for this tour.

The fee for the event is $10 and includes admission to the museum and the group private tour. You can stay and browse the museum at your leisure following the tour.

50% of each ticket sold will go towards the Art Strollers fund, at the end of 2016 the cumulation of the fund will be allocated to art organizations in Toronto offering family programming.



About Art Strollers

Our purpose is to bridge families and art organizations, art institutions, galleries and artists. By engaging families with the arts, we strive to enrich not only the lives of the children and parents but also to contribute to the art world's reach and growth for current and future generations. It is a dual purpose to engage the future generations in appreciating and sustaining the continuous creation and presentation of art - visual and performing.

www.artstrollers.ca
title: Ryerson Image Centre - Suze Lake exhibit

description:
The Journey Home is a Dub and Slam Poetry workshop that teaches the art of performance poetry through self-discovery. Lead by dub poet Cue, the workshop follows the chapters of her book Alpha of Omega and challenges the audience to document their story of Peace, Love, Over-Standing and Home. It then teaches the performance techniques of speed, pause and intonation as tools of expressing ones poetry.

At the end of the workshop the participants will be able to document their own story using poetry using and bring it to life with performance and musical expression. The Journey Home uses the urban interdisciplinary art-form of Dub Poetry; a combination of Spoken word and Music (drumming inclusive) as the catalyst to get the Scarborough community documenting their story. It is an art art-form prevalent in the African and Caribbean communities, and will well represent Scarborough’s cultural make up.

About the FacilitatorCue (Queeverne Kirk) is the Tobagonian Canadian Spoken Word Artist, Author and Dub Poet from Toronto who previously gained recognition in Ottawa Canada as “Q the Romantic Revolutionary." She is also Canadian Broadcasting Corporation’s (CBC) 2005/2007 Poetry Face-off All Star winner in Ottawa. After being crowned the Queen of Spoken Word, Cue went on to publish her most recent poetry collection Alpha of Omega (available at www.blurb.ca) in 2014. She is the founder of the Alpha of Omega Collective, a collective of like-minded Artist and Entrepreneurs which uses the Rastafari mantra of “One Love” (Unity) to improve the quality our community by promoting and showcasing our unique and global make-up through art and cultural showcases.

http://www.poetcue.com/
title: SA Writes: Dub and Slam Poetry Workshop

description:
Current Updates; NODAPL SACRAMENTO and CAPSITY is hosting a NYE Solidarity Party in the name of STANDING ROCK. Tickets are in the above section, purchase yours today and RSVP for the party before the space fills up!




Hello y'all, thank you so much for donating to demand justice. We are in solidarity with thousands of First Nation Peoples and Billions of people across the world resisting choices not representing the public. The Dakota Access Pipeline, Oceti Sakowin prayer gatherings, and mass bank divestment, are microcosms of systemic corruption. This stand for indigenous justice echos many other stands for justice, human rights violations whether it be chemically infused freezing water from a water cannon or a conviction less homicide from a fire arm. Black Lives Matter.

 #sayhername

These systemic issues effect the entirety of the planet, please understand donating what you think you can afford isn’t enough  anymore. We must rise up and answer those that have committed their immediate existence to change, remember, we all feel the momentum, now we must act.

We have an opportunity to show how Sacramento stands with Standing Rock, we are dedicated to adverting any further construction of the Dakota Access Pipeline; or any other pipeline for that matter, we see you Texas. Please Share This if you or anyone you know is willing to travel to Support the Future of fresh water and the well-being of the Earth! We will only be able to take those whom are openly willing to practice radical self-inclusion and radical listening, these are not request as much as initial initiation to the cultural space. So, please if you want to use your body in support bring your friends, AS A REQUIREMENT NATIVE FRIENDS FIRST PLEASE!

It is an extremely cold winter in North Dakota. Period.

The water protectors are going to sleep cold and waking up cold, we know this! The current direction at hand is fundraising, this moment fundraising to provide basic survival requirements; medical supplies, extreme cold weather living structures, in state fire wood. The team orchestrating this symphony of ride shares and money delegations are a delegation comprised of concerned community champions. We decided that If veterans can raise a million dollars so can we, the community of Sacramento! Sí se puede! Sí se puede! Sí se puede!

We have meeting every two weeks in the midtown area of Sacramento. Like the NoDAPL Sacramento Facebook page to follow the status of Standing Rock, and send a message to the page we will get in contact with you!

Mni Wiconi
title: NO DAKOTA ACCESS PIPELINE - SACRAMENTO

ARCS Tampa Bay would like to invite you to renew your membership and journey with us to a 7th year of making science matter in Tampa Bay. A portion of your dues is earmarked for the Scholar Awards given to high performing USF PhD students from the College of  Marine Science and Cancer Research.

PLEASE use this site to renew your membership or make a donation to further the mission of the ARCS Foundation.

 Our scholars are discovering a new understanding of the health of our coastal waters and managing Gulf fisheries and conducting cutting edge research to better understand bone marrow disorders and melanoma cells in the brain.  We need your support to help keep this research going in Tampa Bay.  Your participation will support our four scholars continue their studies.   96% of ARCS Tampa Bay revenue supports the scholarship funds!.
	

The ARCS Foundation advances science and technology in the United States by providing financial awards to academically outstanding U.S. citizens studying to complete degrees in science, engineering and medical research.

It is ARCS Foundation's belief that support of STEM education is essential to US economic growth and technological competitiveness, and helps to ensure continued US leadership in global innovation, health and quality of life.
title: ARCS Tampa Bay Annual Dues and Contributions

description:
meet mama.
MAJOR! explores the life and campaigns of Miss Major Griffin-Gracy, a formerly incarcerated Black transgender elder and activist who has been fighting for the rights of trans women of color for over 40 years. Miss Major is a veteran of the Stonewall Rebellion and a survivor of Attica State Prison, a former sex worker, an elder, and a community leader and human rights activist. She is simply “Mama” to many in her community. Her personal story and activism for transgender civil rights intersects LGBT struggles for justice and equality from the 1960s to today. At the center of her activism is her fierce advocacy for her girls, trans women of color who have survived police brutality and incarceration in men’s jails and prisons. MAJOR! is more than just a biographical documentary: It’s an investigation into critical issues of how the Prison Industrial Complex represents a wide-spread and systematic civil rights violation, as well as a historical portrait of diverse LGBT communities, told with love and humor, and personalized through the lens of a vibrant and charismatic woman. Through first-person narration and innovative visual story telling, MAJOR! seeks to create a living, breathing history of a community's struggle and resilience, as seen and experienced by those who lived it.At the heart of MAJOR! is a social justice framework that puts the subjects at the center of their story. MAJOR! was produced in collaboration with Miss Major, the film’s participants, and a transPOC Community Advisory Board to ensure that these stories, which are so often marginalized, exoticized, or played for tragic drama, retain the agency and humanity of those who tell them.

Please visit Miss Majors Circle of Care here:

http://www.missmajorfilm.com/circle-of-care.html

We would like to acknowledge and honour that all of the work we do is currently being done on unceded Algonquin Territory that was never given up and never surrendered.

OCTEVAW: http://www.octevaw-cocvff.ca/

 Accessibility note:
	 The Mayfair does have an accessible entrance. The bathrooms are not accessible for a wheelchair but the adjacent Shoppers has bathrooms that patrons can use that are accessible.
	 The film will be shown with English subtitles.
	

For Pay What You Can Tickets please e-mail Queering613@gmail.com

 This is a Liberation Space:

 o We build community, we amplify & we pushback o We are working towards inclusivity
	 o We are working towards being critical & self-reflexive
	 o We are working towards self-determination & not just safety
	 o We work to deconstruct systems of oppression & violence
	 o We support people's choices & recognize these choices in

 Queering613 collectively strives to create spaces that are free of as many barriers as possible as means to working towards liberation. This means that we are all responsible for creating the spaces we desire, by educating ourselves, each other and ensuring that we are continually engaging in these conversations and creating relationships of support and collective responsibility. While we recognize that no space is exclusively “safe” for anyone, we must collectively work towards mitigating harms.

 Queering613 works towards recognizing dynamics of power and privilege that exist within society and which have historically oppressed our communities. We believe that these same dynamics and tensions exist within our own communities and we are working continuously towards addressing these tensions and creating supportive spaces. People participating in our events and dance parties are asked to be aware of their language and behavior and to think about whether these may be harming others. Our spaces are not spaces for explicit or implicit violence, racism, sexism, ageism, transphobia, cissexism, sizeism, fatphobia, sexual harassment, and gender policing, or doing anything to another person without their consent. Acting in a way that disrespects, harms others or undermines these values will not be tolerated.
title: Queering613 & OCTEVAW present: Major! A New Documentary Film!

description:
Our popular Thinking Matters: Modern Jewish Philosophy mini-course series kicks off a new semester in September. Join our impressive line-up of local star teachers and CBS experts to wrestle with today’s urgent questions of Jewish philosophy. Can there be such a thing as a Jewish philosophy, or a philosophy of Judaism? How does Judaism relate to the broader question of the relationship of ethics, religion, and theology to philosophy? (For an introduction to Jewish modern thought and philosophy, we recommend Steven Katz’s essay, “Eliezar Berkovits & Modern Jewish Philosophy.”)

Details and readings for select upcoming Thinking Matters classes and mini-courses can be found here. The full 2016–17 mini-course overview can be accessed here.

All classes meet on Thursday evenings from 6:30 – 8 p.m.

PLEASE NOTE THAT YOU DO NOT NEED TO LET US KNOW WHICH SESSION OR SESSIONS YOU WILL ATTEND, BUT YOU MUST BRING YOUR TICKET RECEIPT WITH YOU TO CLASS.

description:
Want to learn how to make restaurant-quality chicken wings at home? Come join us for our chicken wing workshop. We’ll cover everything you need to know in order to make the best wings in your own kitchen. 

We’ll talk about purchasing good quality chicken, brining and curing, frying vs. baking, and how to create signature sauces to go with your wings. Of course, we’ll need some blue cheese and ranch for dipping.


Menu


	Fried Buffalo Wings
	Extra Crispy Oven Baked Wings
	2 Signature Sauces 
	Homemade Ranch Dressing
	Homemade Blue Cheese Dressing

You’ll get hands-on experience making two different types of chicken wings. The atmosphere will be fun and convivial and we’ll have beer and wine. We’ll eat and drink throughout class. This makes for a great date night, night out with friends or evening with your parents/adult children!


Important Event Details

CLASS FORMAT: This is a semi hands-on class. We will all work together to cook the recipes. Everyone will get their hands dirty and be involved in each recipe. This class is limited to 12 students.

SKILL LEVEL: All skill levels are welcome! From beginners to expert chefs, this class is for everyone.

FOOD: There will be a welcome snack for when you arrive and then we will eat throughout class. You’ll get to taste everything we are preparing.

ALLERGIES AND DIETARY RESTRICTIONS: Please let me know of any allergies or dietary restrictions IN ADVANCE and we can talk about accommodations.

DRINKS: I will provide local craft beer, wine water. You’re welcome to bring non-alcoholic beverages to class with you.

ADDRESS: Findlay Kitchen is located at 1719 Elm St. Cincinnati, OH 45202

PARKING: There is often street parking available or you can park in one of the Findlay Market lots. Parking info can be found on the Findlay Market website.

ARRIVAL: The classroom kitchen is all windows and located directly inside the main Findlay Kitchen entrance. You’ll see us when you walk up. The doors will be locked so just knock/buzz and we’ll let you in. We will be watching for arrivals so it shouldn’t be an issue. Please try to arrive around 5:45 pm so we can get started on time.

ATTIRE: Please wear closed toed, non-slip shoes. Please keep your hair pulled back or wear a hat. Otherwise, wear comfortable clothes that could potentially get a little dirty. I will provide aprons. Also, feel free to bring clothes if you need to change after work. There is a nice, clean bathroom where you can change.

WHAT TO BRING: Nothing!

Questions? Email jordan@tablespoooncookingco.com
title: Chicken Wing Workshop with Tablespoon Cooking Co.

description:
In this powerful and transformational workshop, you’ll explore the key tenets of the Extreme Leadership Framework—LEAP: Cultivating Love, Generating Energy, Inspiring Audacity, and Providing Proof—and learn how to apply them to your personal and professional leadership challenges. And then, with personal coaching from Steve Farber and his team, you'll be given all the tools, resources, and experience you'll need to facilitate this workshop for others.

Why Become a Certified Facilitator of The Extreme Leadership Workshop?

1. You’re a consultant, coach, or trainer who’d like to either offer The Extreme Leadership Workshop to your clients and/or build a training and consulting business around it.

2. You work for a company or organization, and you’d like to offer the Extreme Leadership Workshop internally.

3. You have no intention to teach the workshop to others, but you’d like to dive deeper into Extreme Leadership and you’ll use the certification process for your own development.

At the end of this intensive, 4-day program, you’ll be licensed to offer this unique workshop to your clients, your company, your team, your colleagues, or your community; just as important, you’ll become part of The Extreme Leadership Institute community and our exclusive facilitator “tribe.”

The Certification process starts with your participation in the Extreme Leadership Workshop, followed by 3 full days of deep background knowledge, practice of the Workshop, coaching and feedback from Steve Farber and his team, group discussion, business and marketing strategy, and loads of laughter and celebration.

As a Certified Facilitator, You’ll receive:


	License to facilitate the Extreme Leadership Workshop wherever you choose
	Designation as a Certified Facilitator by The Extreme Leadership Institute
	Extreme Leadership Facilitator Guide
	Extreme Leadership Participant Materials
	A signed copy of The Radical Leap - 10th Anniversary Edition & The Radical Edge
	A digital copy of all facilitation materials, including PowerPoint slides and supporting videos.
	Extreme Leadership Institute Certificate of Completion
	Access to the Extreme Leader Facilitator Network, an online resource for sharing of best practices in facilitating Extreme Leadership.
	Exclusive wholesale rates for additional Extreme Leadership Institute products and resources
	Direct access to and support from Steve Farber and his team
	Potential to earn referral business from the Extreme Leadership Institute

At the end of our final morning session, you are invited to join Steve Farber for a celebration Barbecue at his home.



 Continental Breakfast and Lunch are included on all days.
title: Extreme Leadership CERTIFICATION
